title: BladedAnalysis
description: The definition of a single Bladed analysis.
markdownDescription:
### BladedAnalysis

_The definition of a single Bladed analysis._

- `TimeDomainSimulation`: **object (TimeDomainSimulation)**
- `SteadyCalculation`: **object (a type of SteadyCalculation)**
- `Settings`: **object (Settings)**, _Optional_
- `Constants`: **object (Constants)**, _Optional_
- `Turbine`: **object (Turbine)**

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

Aerofoil.title: Aerofoil
Aerofoil.description: The definition of a single 2D aerodynamic aerofoil section.
Aerofoil.markdownDescription:
### Aerofoil

_The definition of a single 2D aerodynamic aerofoil section._

- `ChordwiseOriginForForcesAndMoments`: **number**, _Optional_
- `AerodynamicPerformance`: **array[object (AlphaLine)]**
- `ReynoldsNumber`: **number**
- `ThicknessToChordRatio`: **number**

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

ChordwiseOriginForForcesAndMoments.description: The fraction of the chord from the leading edge to the position about which Cl, Cd, and Cm have been calculated.  This is traditionally 0.25 (25%), but can be any location so long as it is consistent with the provided aerodynamic data.
ChordwiseOriginForForcesAndMoments.markdownDescription:
ChordwiseOriginForForcesAndMoments: **number**

_The fraction of the chord from the leading edge to the position about which Cl, Cd, and Cm have been calculated.  This is traditionally 0.25 (25%), but can be any location so long as it is consistent with the provided aerodynamic data._

Optional, Default = `0.25`

AerodynamicPerformance.description: The relationship between angle of attack, and the lift and drag coefficients.
AerodynamicPerformance.markdownDescription:
AerodynamicPerformance: **array[object (AlphaLine)]**

_The relationship between angle of attack, and the lift and drag coefficients._

ReynoldsNumber.description: The Reynolds number at which the aerodynamic properties were obtained.
ReynoldsNumber.markdownDescription:
ReynoldsNumber: **number**

_The Reynolds number at which the aerodynamic properties were obtained._

ThicknessToChordRatio.description: The ratio between the thickness and the chord length of the measured aerofoil.
ThicknessToChordRatio.markdownDescription:
ThicknessToChordRatio: **number**

_The ratio between the thickness and the chord length of the measured aerofoil._

AlphaLine.title: AlphaLine
AlphaLine.description: The relationship between angle of attack, and the lift and drag coefficients.
AlphaLine.markdownDescription:
### AlphaLine

_The relationship between angle of attack, and the lift and drag coefficients._

- `Angle`: **number** (rad)
- `Cl`: **number**
- `Cd`: **number**
- `Cm`: **number**

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

Angle.description: The angle of attack for which the Cl, Cd, and Cm apply.
Angle.markdownDescription:
Angle: **number** (rad)

_The angle of attack for which the Cl, Cd, and Cm apply._

AerofoilLibrary.title: AerofoilLibrary
AerofoilLibrary.description: A library of Aerofoil objects, each specified with a unique keyword.  This keyword is used for referencing the item elsewhere in the model.
AerofoilLibrary.markdownDescription:
### AerofoilLibrary

_A library of Aerofoil objects, each specified with a unique keyword.  This keyword is used for referencing the item elsewhere in the model._

- _0..n_`<custom-name>`: **object (Aerofoil)**

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

additionalProperties.description: AEROFOIL DATA
additionalProperties.markdownDescription:
_0..n_ <custom-name>: **object (Aerofoil)**

_AEROFOIL DATA_

Aileron.title: Aileron
Aileron.description: An aerofoil whose properties depends on the aileron deployment angle.  For angles between the specified sections, the aerofoil properties will be interpolated.
Aileron.markdownDescription:
### Aileron

_**Not supported yet**_

_An aerofoil whose properties depends on the aileron deployment angle.  For angles between the specified sections, the aerofoil properties will be interpolated._

- _0..n_~~`<deployment-angle>`~~: **string (CrossReference)**

or

- ~~`$insert`~~: **string (URI-reference)**

^(-?\\d*)(\\.?\\d+)?((e-|e\\+|e)\\d+(\\..description: The attribute name must be a valid number representing the deployment angle.  The value is the aerofoil section that is applicable for that deployment angle.
^(-?\\d*)(\\.?\\d+)?((e-|e\\+|e)\\d+(\\..markdownDescription:
_0..n_ <deployment-angle>: **string (CrossReference)**

_**Not supported yet**_

_The attribute name must be a valid number representing the deployment angle.  The value is the aerofoil section that is applicable for that deployment angle._

AileronAerofoilLibrary.title: AileronAerofoilLibrary
AileronAerofoilLibrary.description: A library of aileron or aileron interpolated aerofoil objects, interpolated on their deployment angle.  Each is specified with a unique keyword which is used for referencing the item elsewhere in the model.
AileronAerofoilLibrary.markdownDescription:
### AileronAerofoilLibrary

_**Not supported yet**_

_A library of aileron or aileron interpolated aerofoil objects, interpolated on their deployment angle.  Each is specified with a unique keyword which is used for referencing the item elsewhere in the model._

- _0..n_~~`<custom-name>`~~: **object (Aileron)**

or

- ~~`$insert`~~: **string (URI-reference)**

additionalProperties.description: An aerofoil whose properties depends on the aileron deployment angle.  For angles between the specified sections, the aerofoil properties will be interpolated.
additionalProperties.markdownDescription:
_0..n_ <custom-name>: **object (Aileron)**

_**Not supported yet**_

_An aerofoil whose properties depends on the aileron deployment angle.  For angles between the specified sections, the aerofoil properties will be interpolated._

Blade.title: Blade
Blade.markdownDescription:
### Blade

_A blade component._

- _`ComponentType`_: **string = `Blade`**
- `Modelling`: **object (a type of BladeModelling)**
- `AerofoilLibrary`: **object (AerofoilLibrary)**
- `InterpolatedAerofoilLibrary`: **object (InterpolatedAerofoilLibrary)**, _Optional_
- ~~`AileronAerofoilLibrary`~~: **object (AileronAerofoilLibrary)**, _Optional_
- `Mounting`: **object (Mounting)**, _Optional_
- `ToleranceForRepeatedCrossSections`: **number** (m), _Optional_
- `CrossSections`: **array[object (CrossSection)]**
- `AdditionalInertia`: **object (BladeAdditionalInertia)**, _Optional_
- ~~`OutputGroups`~~: **object (BladeOutputGroupLibrary)**, _Optional_

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

A type of **Component**

ComponentType.description: Defines the specific type of Component model in use.  For a `Blade` object, this must always be set to a value of `Blade`.
ComponentType.markdownDescription:
ComponentType: **string = `Blade` | `DrivetrainAndNacelle` | `ExternalModuleComponent` | `FixedSpeedActiveDamper` | `Flexibility` | `IndependentPitchHub` | `Lidar` | `LinearPassiveDamper` | `PendulumDamper` | `PitchSystem` | `RigidBodyPointInertia` | `RigidBodySixbySixInertia` | `Rotation` | `Superelement` | `Tower` | `Translation` | `VariableSpeedActiveDamper` | `VariableSpeedGenerator` | `YawSystem`**

_Defines the specific type of Component model in use.  For a `Blade` object, this must always be set to a value of `Blade`._

---

### Blade

_A blade component._

- _`ComponentType`_: **string = `Blade`**
- `Modelling`: **object (a type of BladeModelling)**
- `AerofoilLibrary`: **object (AerofoilLibrary)**
- `InterpolatedAerofoilLibrary`: **object (InterpolatedAerofoilLibrary)**, _Optional_
- ~~`AileronAerofoilLibrary`~~: **object (AileronAerofoilLibrary)**, _Optional_
- `Mounting`: **object (Mounting)**, _Optional_
- `ToleranceForRepeatedCrossSections`: **number** (m), _Optional_
- `CrossSections`: **array[object (CrossSection)]**
- `AdditionalInertia`: **object (BladeAdditionalInertia)**, _Optional_
- ~~`OutputGroups`~~: **object (BladeOutputGroupLibrary)**, _Optional_

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

A type of **Component**

Modelling.description: Common properties for all blade modelling methods.
Modelling.markdownDescription:
Modelling: **object (a type of BladeModelling)**

_Common properties for all blade modelling methods._

**BladeModelling** types: `FiniteElementBladeModelling`, `ModalBladeModelling`, `RigidBladeModelling`

AerofoilLibrary.description: A library of Aerofoil objects, each specified with a unique keyword.  This keyword is used for referencing the item elsewhere in the model.
AerofoilLibrary.markdownDescription:
AerofoilLibrary: **object (AerofoilLibrary)**

_A library of Aerofoil objects, each specified with a unique keyword.  This keyword is used for referencing the item elsewhere in the model._

InterpolatedAerofoilLibrary.description: A set of compound aerofoil definitions which interpolate between basic aerofoil definitions on the basis of Reynolds Number of thickness to chord ratio.
InterpolatedAerofoilLibrary.markdownDescription:
InterpolatedAerofoilLibrary: **object (InterpolatedAerofoilLibrary)**

_A set of compound aerofoil definitions which interpolate between basic aerofoil definitions on the basis of Reynolds Number of thickness to chord ratio._

Optional

AileronAerofoilLibrary.description: A set of compound aerofoil definitions which interpolate between basic aerofoil definitions on the basis of the aileron's deployment angle.
AileronAerofoilLibrary.markdownDescription:
AileronAerofoilLibrary: **object (AileronAerofoilLibrary)**

_**Not supported yet**_

_A set of compound aerofoil definitions which interpolate between basic aerofoil definitions on the basis of the aileron's deployment angle._

Optional

Mounting.description: The blade mounting angles, outboard of pitch bearing.
Mounting.markdownDescription:
Mounting: **object (Mounting)**

_The blade mounting angles, outboard of pitch bearing._

Optional

ToleranceForRepeatedCrossSections.description: The tolerance used to determine whether two blade cross-sections are merely adjacent, or represent a step-change in properties at a discrete point.  If the plane point of the reference axes lie within this distance of each other, then it will be taken that the two blade cross-section definitions represent the properties inboard and outboard of a single structural point.
ToleranceForRepeatedCrossSections.markdownDescription:
ToleranceForRepeatedCrossSections: **number** (m)

_The tolerance used to determine whether two blade cross-sections are merely adjacent, or represent a step-change in properties at a discrete point.  If the plane point of the reference axes lie within this distance of each other, then it will be taken that the two blade cross-section definitions represent the properties inboard and outboard of a single structural point._

Optional, Default = `0.001`

CrossSections.description: A list of blade cross-sections which describes the geometric, structural, and aerodynamic properties of the blade.
CrossSections.markdownDescription:
CrossSections: **array[object (CrossSection)]**

_A list of blade cross-sections which describes the geometric, structural, and aerodynamic properties of the blade._

AdditionalInertia.description: The definition of additional inertias applied in the whole blade context.
AdditionalInertia.markdownDescription:
AdditionalInertia: **object (BladeAdditionalInertia)**

_The definition of additional inertias applied in the whole blade context._

Optional, Default = `0.0`

OutputGroups.description: A library of output regimes which can be referenced by the simulation.  The details of what will be output will be unavailable if the component is encrypted, but other users will be able to see and reference the output group names.
OutputGroups.markdownDescription:
OutputGroups: **object (BladeOutputGroupLibrary)**

_**Not supported yet**_

_A library of output regimes which can be referenced by the simulation.  The details of what will be output will be unavailable if the component is encrypted, but other users will be able to see and reference the output group names._

Optional

BladeAdditionalInertia.title: BladeAdditionalInertia
BladeAdditionalInertia.description: The definition of additional inertias applied in the whole blade context.
BladeAdditionalInertia.markdownDescription:
### BladeAdditionalInertia

_The definition of additional inertias applied in the whole blade context._

- `PointInertias`: **array[object (BladePointMass)]**, _Optional_
- `AdditionalWholeBladePitchingInertia`: **number** (kgrad²), _Optional_

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

PointInertias.description: A list of point inertias to be applied to the blade structure.
PointInertias.markdownDescription:
PointInertias: **array[object (BladePointMass)]**

_A list of point inertias to be applied to the blade structure._

Optional

AdditionalWholeBladePitchingInertia.description: Any additional pitching inertia on the whole blade.
AdditionalWholeBladePitchingInertia.markdownDescription:
AdditionalWholeBladePitchingInertia: **number** (kgrad²)

_Any additional pitching inertia on the whole blade._

Optional, Default = `0.0`

BladePointMass.title: BladePointMass
BladePointMass.description: A point mass with rotational inertia on the blade.  This is defined in the blade root axes.
BladePointMass.markdownDescription:
### BladePointMass

_A point mass with rotational inertia on the blade.  This is defined in the blade root axes._

- `LocationInRootAxes`: **object (Vector3D)**
- `Mass`: **number** (kg)

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

LocationInRootAxes.description: The acting location for the mass and inertia, specified in the blade root coordinate system.
LocationInRootAxes.markdownDescription:
LocationInRootAxes: **object (Vector3D)**

_The acting location for the mass and inertia, specified in the blade root coordinate system._

FiniteElementBladeModelling.title: FiniteElementBladeModelling
FiniteElementBladeModelling.description: The properties for the structural modelling of the blade using finite element analysis without modal reduction.
FiniteElementBladeModelling.markdownDescription:
### FiniteElementBladeModelling

_The properties for the structural modelling of the blade using finite element analysis without modal reduction._

- _`BladeModellingType`_: **string = `FiniteElementBladeModelling`**
- `GeometricStiffnessModel`: **string = `AxialLoadsOnly` | `FullModelWithOrientationCorrection` | `InternalLoadsOnly` | `Disabled`**, _Optional_
- `IgnoreAxesOrientationDifferencesForShear`: **boolean**, _Optional_
- `WholeBladeModeDampingRatios`: **array[object (StructuralMode)]**

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

A type of **BladeModelling**

BladeModellingType.description: Defines the specific type of BladeModelling model in use.  For a `FiniteElementBladeModelling` object, this must always be set to a value of `FiniteElementBladeModelling`.
BladeModellingType.markdownDescription:
BladeModellingType: **string = `FiniteElementBladeModelling` | `ModalBladeModelling` | `RigidBladeModelling`**

_Defines the specific type of BladeModelling model in use.  For a `FiniteElementBladeModelling` object, this must always be set to a value of `FiniteElementBladeModelling`._

---

### FiniteElementBladeModelling

_The properties for the structural modelling of the blade using finite element analysis without modal reduction._

- _`BladeModellingType`_: **string = `FiniteElementBladeModelling`**
- `GeometricStiffnessModel`: **string = `AxialLoadsOnly` | `FullModelWithOrientationCorrection` | `InternalLoadsOnly` | `Disabled`**, _Optional_
- `IgnoreAxesOrientationDifferencesForShear`: **boolean**, _Optional_
- `WholeBladeModeDampingRatios`: **array[object (StructuralMode)]**

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

A type of **BladeModelling**

WholeBladeModeDampingRatios.description: List of known whole-blade mode damping ratios. The whole-blade damping ratios will be converted into finite element degrees of freedom by Bladed. If the list is incomplete, meaning it lacks damping ratios for all modes, Bladed will assign frequency-proportional damping based on the damping ratio of the highest defined mode. The list must contain at least one entry.
WholeBladeModeDampingRatios.markdownDescription:
WholeBladeModeDampingRatios: **array[object (StructuralMode)]**

_List of known whole-blade mode damping ratios. The whole-blade damping ratios will be converted into finite element degrees of freedom by Bladed. If the list is incomplete, meaning it lacks damping ratios for all modes, Bladed will assign frequency-proportional damping based on the damping ratio of the highest defined mode. The list must contain at least one entry._

ModalBladeModelling.title: ModalBladeModelling
ModalBladeModelling.description: The properties for the structural modelling of the blade using modal reduction.
ModalBladeModelling.markdownDescription:
### ModalBladeModelling

_The properties for the structural modelling of the blade using modal reduction._

- _`BladeModellingType`_: **string = `ModalBladeModelling`**
- `GeometricStiffnessModel`: **string = `AxialLoadsOnly` | `FullModelWithOrientationCorrection` | `InternalLoadsOnly` | `Disabled`**, _Optional_
- `IgnoreAxesOrientationDifferencesForShear`: **boolean**, _Optional_
- `WholeBladeModeDampingRatios`: **array[object (StructuralMode)]**
- `NumberOfModesPerBladePart`: **integer**, _Optional_

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

A type of **BladeModelling**

BladeModellingType.description: Defines the specific type of BladeModelling model in use.  For a `ModalBladeModelling` object, this must always be set to a value of `ModalBladeModelling`.
BladeModellingType.markdownDescription:
BladeModellingType: **string = `FiniteElementBladeModelling` | `ModalBladeModelling` | `RigidBladeModelling`**

_Defines the specific type of BladeModelling model in use.  For a `ModalBladeModelling` object, this must always be set to a value of `ModalBladeModelling`._

---

### ModalBladeModelling

_The properties for the structural modelling of the blade using modal reduction._

- _`BladeModellingType`_: **string = `ModalBladeModelling`**
- `GeometricStiffnessModel`: **string = `AxialLoadsOnly` | `FullModelWithOrientationCorrection` | `InternalLoadsOnly` | `Disabled`**, _Optional_
- `IgnoreAxesOrientationDifferencesForShear`: **boolean**, _Optional_
- `WholeBladeModeDampingRatios`: **array[object (StructuralMode)]**
- `NumberOfModesPerBladePart`: **integer**, _Optional_

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

A type of **BladeModelling**

WholeBladeModeDampingRatios.description: List of known whole-blade mode damping ratios. If the list is incomplete, meaning it lacks damping ratios for all modes, Bladed will assign frequency-proportional damping based on the damping ratio of the highest defined mode. The list must contain at least one entry.
WholeBladeModeDampingRatios.markdownDescription:
WholeBladeModeDampingRatios: **array[object (StructuralMode)]**

_List of known whole-blade mode damping ratios. If the list is incomplete, meaning it lacks damping ratios for all modes, Bladed will assign frequency-proportional damping based on the damping ratio of the highest defined mode. The list must contain at least one entry._

NumberOfModesPerBladePart.description: The number of modes used to represent each blade part, or the whole blade if it is represented by a single multibody object.  This should be sufficiently high to capture all of the relevant blade modes, but the higher it is the slower the simulation will become.
NumberOfModesPerBladePart.markdownDescription:
NumberOfModesPerBladePart: **integer**

_The number of modes used to represent each blade part, or the whole blade if it is represented by a single multibody object.  This should be sufficiently high to capture all of the relevant blade modes, but the higher it is the slower the simulation will become._

Optional, Default = `4`

RigidBladeModelling.title: RigidBladeModelling
RigidBladeModelling.description: The properties for modelling the blade as being completely rigid.
RigidBladeModelling.markdownDescription:
### RigidBladeModelling

_The properties for modelling the blade as being completely rigid._

- _`BladeModellingType`_: **string = `RigidBladeModelling`**
- `GeometricStiffnessModel`: **string = `AxialLoadsOnly` | `FullModelWithOrientationCorrection` | `InternalLoadsOnly` | `Disabled`**, _Optional_
- `IgnoreAxesOrientationDifferencesForShear`: **boolean**, _Optional_

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

A type of **BladeModelling**

BladeModellingType.description: Defines the specific type of BladeModelling model in use.  For a `RigidBladeModelling` object, this must always be set to a value of `RigidBladeModelling`.
BladeModellingType.markdownDescription:
BladeModellingType: **string = `FiniteElementBladeModelling` | `ModalBladeModelling` | `RigidBladeModelling`**

_Defines the specific type of BladeModelling model in use.  For a `RigidBladeModelling` object, this must always be set to a value of `RigidBladeModelling`._

---

### RigidBladeModelling

_The properties for modelling the blade as being completely rigid._

- _`BladeModellingType`_: **string = `RigidBladeModelling`**
- `GeometricStiffnessModel`: **string = `AxialLoadsOnly` | `FullModelWithOrientationCorrection` | `InternalLoadsOnly` | `Disabled`**, _Optional_
- `IgnoreAxesOrientationDifferencesForShear`: **boolean**, _Optional_

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

A type of **BladeModelling**

GeometricStiffnessModel.description: The geometric stiffness model to use for the blades. For blades with 1 part, the "axial loads only" model is recommended. This configuration is only appropriate for relatively stiff blades, undergoing small deflection.  For more flexible blade models, a multi-part blade model is more appropriate. In this case, the "full with orientation correction" is the recommended option, as long as deflection remains small within each blade part.
GeometricStiffnessModel.markdownDescription:
GeometricStiffnessModel: **string = `AxialLoadsOnly` | `FullModelWithOrientationCorrection` | `InternalLoadsOnly` | `Disabled`**

_The geometric stiffness model to use for the blades. For blades with 1 part, the "axial loads only" model is recommended. This configuration is only appropriate for relatively stiff blades, undergoing small deflection.  For more flexible blade models, a multi-part blade model is more appropriate. In this case, the "full with orientation correction" is the recommended option, as long as deflection remains small within each blade part._

Optional, Default = `AxialLoadsOnly`

IgnoreAxesOrientationDifferencesForShear.description: With this option selected, the effect of orientation difference between the elastic axis and shear axis on the blade elements are not taken into account. Please refer to the theory manual for details (blade bend-twist coupling).
IgnoreAxesOrientationDifferencesForShear.markdownDescription:
IgnoreAxesOrientationDifferencesForShear: **boolean**

_With this option selected, the effect of orientation difference between the elastic axis and shear axis on the blade elements are not taken into account. Please refer to the theory manual for details (blade bend-twist coupling)._

Optional, Default = `false`

WaterKinematics.description: If true, output water blade kinematics (tidal only)
WaterKinematics.markdownDescription:
WaterKinematics: **boolean**

_**Not supported yet**_

_If true, output water blade kinematics (tidal only)_

Optional, Default = `false`

AerodynamicProperties.title: AerodynamicProperties
AerodynamicProperties.description: The aerodynamic properties of the blade cross-section.  These are defined in the QuarterChordCoordinateSystem, which specifies the position and orientation of the aerofoil.
AerodynamicProperties.markdownDescription:
### AerodynamicProperties

_The aerodynamic properties of the blade cross-section.  These are defined in the QuarterChordCoordinateSystem, which specifies the position and orientation of the aerofoil._

- `Chord`: **number** (m)
- `ThicknessToChordRatio`: **number**
- `@AerodynamicData`: **string (AerofoilKey)**

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

Chord.description: The chord of the blade at this cross-section, measured from leading to trailing edge.  The cross-section will be positioned so that the aerofoil's quarter-chord position coincides with the origin of the QuarterChordCoordinateSystem.
Chord.markdownDescription:
Chord: **number** (m)

_The chord of the blade at this cross-section, measured from leading to trailing edge.  The cross-section will be positioned so that the aerofoil's quarter-chord position coincides with the origin of the QuarterChordCoordinateSystem._

ThicknessToChordRatio.description: The ratio between the thickness and the chord length at the cross-section.  This would be 1.0 for a cylinder, and in the order of 0.1 (or 10%) for a typical slender aerofoil section.
ThicknessToChordRatio.markdownDescription:
ThicknessToChordRatio: **number**

_The ratio between the thickness and the chord length at the cross-section.  This would be 1.0 for a cylinder, and in the order of 0.1 (or 10%) for a typical slender aerofoil section._

@AerodynamicData.description:
A reference to an aerofoil, interpolated aerofoil, or aileron aerofoil to use for this cross-section.  The value must be the key of an aerofoil definition in either the AerofoilLibrary, InterpolatedAerofoilLibrary or AileronAerofoilLibrary.

i.e.

`AerofoilLibrary.<key>` or
`InterpolatedAerofoilLibrary.<key>` or
`AileronAerofoilLibrary.<key>`
@AerodynamicData.markdownDescription:
@AerodynamicData: **string (AerofoilKey)**

_A reference to an aerofoil, interpolated aerofoil, or aileron aerofoil to use for this cross-section.  The value must be the key of an aerofoil definition in either the AerofoilLibrary, InterpolatedAerofoilLibrary or AileronAerofoilLibrary._

_i.e._

_`AerofoilLibrary.<key>` or_

_`InterpolatedAerofoilLibrary.<key>` or_

_`AileronAerofoilLibrary.<key>`_

CoordinateSystems.title: CoordinateSystems
CoordinateSystems.description: The coordinate systems of the blade cross-section.  If a coordinate system is not specified, it defaults to the ReferenceCoordinateSystem.  Consequently, any coordinate system may serve as the reference coordinate system.
CoordinateSystems.markdownDescription:
### CoordinateSystems

_The coordinate systems of the blade cross-section.  If a coordinate system is not specified, it defaults to the ReferenceCoordinateSystem.  Consequently, any coordinate system may serve as the reference coordinate system._

- `ReferenceCoordinateSystem`: **object (ReferenceCoordinateSystem)**
- `QuarterChordCoordinateSystem`: **object (OffsetAndRotatedCoordinateSystem)**, _Optional_
- `PrincipalInertiaCoordinateSystem`: **object (OffsetAndRotatedCoordinateSystem)**, _Optional_
- `PrincipalElasticCoordinateSystem`: **object (OffsetAndRotatedCoordinateSystem)**, _Optional_
- `PrincipalShearCoordinateSystem`: **object (OffsetAndRotatedCoordinateSystem)**, _Optional_

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

ReferenceCoordinateSystem.description: The main coordinate system of the cross-section, from which all other coordinate systems are derived.  If a coordinate system is not specified, it defaults to the ReferenceCoordinateSystem.  Consequently, any coordinate system may serve as the reference coordinate system.
ReferenceCoordinateSystem.markdownDescription:
ReferenceCoordinateSystem: **object (ReferenceCoordinateSystem)**

_The main coordinate system of the cross-section, from which all other coordinate systems are derived.  If a coordinate system is not specified, it defaults to the ReferenceCoordinateSystem.  Consequently, any coordinate system may serve as the reference coordinate system._

QuarterChordCoordinateSystem.description: This coordinate system positions the aerofoil relative to the reference coordinate system.  The origin is located at the quarter-chord position, which is one-quarter of the distance from the leading edge to the trailing edge along the chordline. The X-axis of the coordinate system coincides with the chordline, while the Y-axis is perpendicular to it.  If omitted, it will default to the ReferenceCoordinateSystem.
QuarterChordCoordinateSystem.markdownDescription:
QuarterChordCoordinateSystem: **object (OffsetAndRotatedCoordinateSystem)**

_This coordinate system positions the aerofoil relative to the reference coordinate system.  The origin is located at the quarter-chord position, which is one-quarter of the distance from the leading edge to the trailing edge along the chordline. The X-axis of the coordinate system coincides with the chordline, while the Y-axis is perpendicular to it.  If omitted, it will default to the ReferenceCoordinateSystem._

Optional

PrincipalInertiaCoordinateSystem.description: The coordinate system where the mass and inertia properties are defined.  The origin is located at the centre of gravity of the cross-section. The X- and Y-axis are oriented according to the principal inertia directions.  If omitted, the principal inertia coordinate system will default to the ReferenceCoordinateSystem.
PrincipalInertiaCoordinateSystem.markdownDescription:
PrincipalInertiaCoordinateSystem: **object (OffsetAndRotatedCoordinateSystem)**

_The coordinate system where the mass and inertia properties are defined.  The origin is located at the centre of gravity of the cross-section. The X- and Y-axis are oriented according to the principal inertia directions.  If omitted, the principal inertia coordinate system will default to the ReferenceCoordinateSystem._

Optional

PrincipalElasticCoordinateSystem.description: The coordinate system where stiffness properties, excluding torsional stiffness, are defined.  The origin is located at the elastic centre, the point where a force applied perpendicular to the cross-section plane causes no bending.  The X- and Y-axis are oriented according to the principal elastic directions. If omitted, it will default to the ReferenceCoordinateSystem.
PrincipalElasticCoordinateSystem.markdownDescription:
PrincipalElasticCoordinateSystem: **object (OffsetAndRotatedCoordinateSystem)**

_The coordinate system where stiffness properties, excluding torsional stiffness, are defined.  The origin is located at the elastic centre, the point where a force applied perpendicular to the cross-section plane causes no bending.  The X- and Y-axis are oriented according to the principal elastic directions. If omitted, it will default to the ReferenceCoordinateSystem._

Optional

PrincipalShearCoordinateSystem.description: The coordinate system where the torsional stiffness is defined.  The origin is located at the shear centre, the point where a load applied parallel to the cross-section plane causes no torsion. The X- and Y-axis are oriented according to the principal shear directions.  If omitted, it will default to the PrincipalElasticCoordinateSystem.
PrincipalShearCoordinateSystem.markdownDescription:
PrincipalShearCoordinateSystem: **object (OffsetAndRotatedCoordinateSystem)**

_The coordinate system where the torsional stiffness is defined.  The origin is located at the shear centre, the point where a load applied parallel to the cross-section plane causes no torsion. The X- and Y-axis are oriented according to the principal shear directions.  If omitted, it will default to the PrincipalElasticCoordinateSystem._

Optional

OffsetAndRotatedCoordinateSystem.title: OffsetAndRotatedCoordinateSystem
OffsetAndRotatedCoordinateSystem.description: The X- and Y-offsets and a rotation, relative to the ReferenceCoordinateSystem, are used to position and orient a coordinate system.
OffsetAndRotatedCoordinateSystem.markdownDescription:
### OffsetAndRotatedCoordinateSystem

_The X- and Y-offsets and a rotation, relative to the ReferenceCoordinateSystem, are used to position and orient a coordinate system._

- `OffsetInReferenceX`: **number** (m), _Optional_
- `OffsetInReferenceY`: **number** (m), _Optional_
- `RotationAboutReferenceZ`: **number** (rad), _Optional_

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

OffsetInReferenceX.description: The X-offset of the coordinate system origin along the reference X-axis, relative to the ReferenceCoordinateSystem.
OffsetInReferenceX.markdownDescription:
OffsetInReferenceX: **number** (m)

_The X-offset of the coordinate system origin along the reference X-axis, relative to the ReferenceCoordinateSystem._

Optional, Default = `0.0`

OffsetInReferenceY.description: The Y-offset of the coordinate system origin along the reference Y-axis, relative to the ReferenceCoordinateSystem.
OffsetInReferenceY.markdownDescription:
OffsetInReferenceY: **number** (m)

_The Y-offset of the coordinate system origin along the reference Y-axis, relative to the ReferenceCoordinateSystem._

Optional, Default = `0.0`

RotationAboutReferenceZ.description: The rotation of the coordinate system's X- and Y-axes around the reference Z-axis (the section plane normal).
RotationAboutReferenceZ.markdownDescription:
RotationAboutReferenceZ: **number** (rad)

_The rotation of the coordinate system's X- and Y-axes around the reference Z-axis (the section plane normal)._

Optional, Default = `0.0`

PointOnSpan.title: PointOnSpan
PointOnSpan.description: A position along the span of the blade, defined either in full 3D, or as if the blade had been flattened into 2D (i.e. disregarding pre-bend and pre-sweep).
PointOnSpan.markdownDescription:
### PointOnSpan

_A position along the span of the blade, defined either in full 3D, or as if the blade had been flattened into 2D (i.e. disregarding pre-bend and pre-sweep)._

- `X`: **number** (m), _Optional_
- `Y`: **number** (m), _Optional_
- `Z`: **number** (m)
- `DistanceAlongSpan`: **number** (m)

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

X.description: The offset of the point from the blade's pitch axis (the z-axis) in the blade root's X direction.
X.markdownDescription:
X: **number** (m)

_The offset of the point from the blade's pitch axis (the z-axis) in the blade root's X direction._

Optional, Default = `0.0`

Y.description: The offset of the point from the blade's pitch axis (the z- axis) in the blade root's Y direction.
Y.markdownDescription:
Y: **number** (m)

_The offset of the point from the blade's pitch axis (the z- axis) in the blade root's Y direction._

Optional, Default = `0.0`

Z.description: The spanwise location of the point along the blade's pitch axis (the blade root axes' z-axis).  This is the absolute 3D position, including any pre-bend or pre-sweep.
Z.markdownDescription:
Z: **number** (m)

_The spanwise location of the point along the blade's pitch axis (the blade root axes' z-axis).  This is the absolute 3D position, including any pre-bend or pre-sweep._

DistanceAlongSpan.description: The spanwise location of the point along the blade's pitch axis (the blade root z-axis), as measured along the blade's reference curve, which connects the origins of each blade cross-section.  This would be the distance along the undeformed blade, should it lie flat in a plane.  This is used when the pre-bend and pre-sweep has yet to be finalised, as the PlanformDistance will remain constant for any value of X and Y.
DistanceAlongSpan.markdownDescription:
DistanceAlongSpan: **number** (m)

_The spanwise location of the point along the blade's pitch axis (the blade root z-axis), as measured along the blade's reference curve, which connects the origins of each blade cross-section.  This would be the distance along the undeformed blade, should it lie flat in a plane.  This is used when the pre-bend and pre-sweep has yet to be finalised, as the PlanformDistance will remain constant for any value of X and Y._

ReferenceCoordinateSystem.title: ReferenceCoordinateSystem
ReferenceCoordinateSystem.description: The main coordinate system of the cross-section, from which all other coordinate systems are derived.  If a coordinate system is not specified, it defaults to the ReferenceCoordinateSystem.  Consequently, any coordinate system may serve as the reference coordinate system.
ReferenceCoordinateSystem.markdownDescription:
### ReferenceCoordinateSystem

_The main coordinate system of the cross-section, from which all other coordinate systems are derived.  If a coordinate system is not specified, it defaults to the ReferenceCoordinateSystem.  Consequently, any coordinate system may serve as the reference coordinate system._

- `Origin`: **object (PointOnSpan)**
- `ZAxis`: **object (Vector3D)**, _Optional_
- `RotationAboutReferenceZ`: **number** (rad), _Optional_
- `YAxis`: **object (Vector3D)**, _Optional_

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

Origin.description: A position along the span of the blade.  This will be used as the local origin for the reference coordinate system.
Origin.markdownDescription:
Origin: **object (PointOnSpan)**

_A position along the span of the blade.  This will be used as the local origin for the reference coordinate system._

ZAxis.description: The normal to the cross-section's plane, which represents the local Z-axis.  If omitted, the component's Z-direction will be used.
ZAxis.markdownDescription:
ZAxis: **object (Vector3D)**

_The normal to the cross-section's plane, which represents the local Z-axis.  If omitted, the component's Z-direction will be used._

Optional

RotationAboutReferenceZ.description: This specifies the ReferenceCoordinateSystem's local Y-axis direction.  A vector specifying the YAxis explicitly can be provided instead, or without either the Y-axis will lie on the component's YZ-plane.
RotationAboutReferenceZ.markdownDescription:
RotationAboutReferenceZ: **number** (rad)

_This specifies the ReferenceCoordinateSystem's local Y-axis direction.  A vector specifying the YAxis explicitly can be provided instead, or without either the Y-axis will lie on the component's YZ-plane._

Optional

YAxis.description: The local Y-axis direction.  This will be rectified to ensure it is perpendicular to the ZAxis property.  A rotation can be provided instead, or without either the Y-axis will lie on the component's YZ-plane.
YAxis.markdownDescription:
YAxis: **object (Vector3D)**

_The local Y-axis direction.  This will be rectified to ensure it is perpendicular to the ZAxis property.  A rotation can be provided instead, or without either the Y-axis will lie on the component's YZ-plane._

Optional

CrossSection.title: CrossSection
CrossSection.description: A blade cross-section which defines the geometric, structural, and aerodynamic properties of the blade.
CrossSection.markdownDescription:
### CrossSection

_A blade cross-section which defines the geometric, structural, and aerodynamic properties of the blade._

- `IsCrossSectionAMultipartBoundary`: **boolean**, _Optional_
- `CoordinateSystems`: **object (CoordinateSystems)**
- `StiffnessProperties`: **object (StiffnessProperties)**, _Optional_
- `AerodynamicProperties`: **object (AerodynamicProperties)**
- `MassProperties`: **object (MassProperties)**, _Optional_
- `Sensors`: **array[object (a type of Sensor)]**, _Optional_

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

IsCrossSectionAMultipartBoundary.description: If true, this cross-section will serve as a boundary between parts of a multipart blade, allowing the blade to be split accordingly. Note that it is not possible to split the blade at the first or last cross-section of the blade.
IsCrossSectionAMultipartBoundary.markdownDescription:
IsCrossSectionAMultipartBoundary: **boolean**

_If true, this cross-section will serve as a boundary between parts of a multipart blade, allowing the blade to be split accordingly. Note that it is not possible to split the blade at the first or last cross-section of the blade._

Optional, Default = `false`

CoordinateSystems.description: The coordinate systems of the blade cross-section.  If a coordinate system is not specified, it defaults to the ReferenceCoordinateSystem.  Consequently, any coordinate system may serve as the reference coordinate system.
CoordinateSystems.markdownDescription:
CoordinateSystems: **object (CoordinateSystems)**

_The coordinate systems of the blade cross-section.  If a coordinate system is not specified, it defaults to the ReferenceCoordinateSystem.  Consequently, any coordinate system may serve as the reference coordinate system._

StiffnessProperties.description: The stiffness properties of the blade cross-section. All properties, except for torsional stiffness, are defined in the PrincipalElasticCoordinateSystem. Torsional stiffness is defined in the PrincipalShearCoordinateSystem.
StiffnessProperties.markdownDescription:
StiffnessProperties: **object (StiffnessProperties)**

_The stiffness properties of the blade cross-section. All properties, except for torsional stiffness, are defined in the PrincipalElasticCoordinateSystem. Torsional stiffness is defined in the PrincipalShearCoordinateSystem._

Optional

AerodynamicProperties.description: The aerodynamic properties of the blade cross-section.  These are defined in the QuarterChordCoordinateSystem, which specifies the position and orientation of the aerofoil.
AerodynamicProperties.markdownDescription:
AerodynamicProperties: **object (AerodynamicProperties)**

_The aerodynamic properties of the blade cross-section.  These are defined in the QuarterChordCoordinateSystem, which specifies the position and orientation of the aerofoil._

MassProperties.description: The mass properties of the blade cross-section, expressed per unit length where appropriate.  These are defined in the PrincipalInertiaCoordinateSystem.
MassProperties.markdownDescription:
MassProperties: **object (MassProperties)**

_The mass properties of the blade cross-section, expressed per unit length where appropriate.  These are defined in the PrincipalInertiaCoordinateSystem._

Optional

Sensors.description: A list of sensors that the external controller has access to.  The indices of the sensors will depend on their type (LoadSensor, Accelerometer, or Inclinometer) and the order in which they are defined on the Blade, from inboard to outpurd.  The details of exactly where the sensors are will be unavailable if the component is encrypted.
Sensors.markdownDescription:
Sensors: **array[object (a type of Sensor)]**

_A list of sensors that the external controller has access to.  The indices of the sensors will depend on their type (LoadSensor, Accelerometer, or Inclinometer) and the order in which they are defined on the Blade, from inboard to outpurd.  The details of exactly where the sensors are will be unavailable if the component is encrypted._

Optional

MassProperties.title: MassProperties
MassProperties.description: The mass properties of the cross-section, expressed per unit length where appropriate.  These are defined in the PrincipalInertiaCoordinateSystem.
MassProperties.markdownDescription:
### MassProperties

_The mass properties of the cross-section, expressed per unit length where appropriate.  These are defined in the PrincipalInertiaCoordinateSystem._

- `MassPerUnitLength`: **number** (kg/m)
- `PolarMassMomentOfInertia`: **number** (kgrad²/m)
- `RadiusOfGyrationRatio`: **number**, _Optional_

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

PolarMassMomentOfInertia.description: The polar mass moment of inertia per unit length at the mass centre, as defined by the PrincipalInertiaCoordinateSystem.
PolarMassMomentOfInertia.markdownDescription:
PolarMassMomentOfInertia: **number** (kgrad²/m)

_The polar mass moment of inertia per unit length at the mass centre, as defined by the PrincipalInertiaCoordinateSystem._

RadiusOfGyrationRatio.description: The ratio of the radius of gyration along the principal inertia Y-axis divided by the radius of gyration in the principal inertia X-axis, as defined by the PrincipalInertiaCoordinateSystem.
RadiusOfGyrationRatio.markdownDescription:
RadiusOfGyrationRatio: **number**

_The ratio of the radius of gyration along the principal inertia Y-axis divided by the radius of gyration in the principal inertia X-axis, as defined by the PrincipalInertiaCoordinateSystem._

Optional

BendingTorsionCouplingTermsAboutElasticX.title: BendingTorsionCouplingTermsAboutElasticXY
BendingTorsionCouplingTermsAboutElasticX.description: The bending-torsion and bending-bending stiffness coupling terms about the principal elastic X- and Y-axes, as defined by the PrincipalElasticCoordinateSystem.
BendingTorsionCouplingTermsAboutElasticX.markdownDescription:
### BendingTorsionCouplingTermsAboutElasticXY

_The bending-torsion and bending-bending stiffness coupling terms about the principal elastic X- and Y-axes, as defined by the PrincipalElasticCoordinateSystem._

- `TorsionBendingCouplingAboutElasticYZ`: **number** (Nm/rad), _Optional_

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

BendingBendingCouplingAboutElasticXY.description: The stiffness coupling term between the bending stiffness about the principal elastic X- and Y-axes, as defined by the PrincipalElasticCoordinateSystem.
BendingBendingCouplingAboutElasticXY.markdownDescription:
BendingBendingCouplingAboutElasticXY: **number** (Nm/rad)

_The stiffness coupling term between the bending stiffness about the principal elastic X- and Y-axes, as defined by the PrincipalElasticCoordinateSystem._

Optional, Default = `0.0`

TorsionBendingCouplingAboutElasticXZ.description: The stiffness coupling term between the bending stiffness about the principal elastic X-axis and torsional stiffness about the principal elastic Z-axis, as defined by the PrincipalElasticCoordinateSystem.
TorsionBendingCouplingAboutElasticXZ.markdownDescription:
TorsionBendingCouplingAboutElasticXZ: **number** (Nm/rad)

_The stiffness coupling term between the bending stiffness about the principal elastic X-axis and torsional stiffness about the principal elastic Z-axis, as defined by the PrincipalElasticCoordinateSystem._

Optional, Default = `0.0`

TorsionBendingCouplingAboutElasticYZ.description: The stiffness coupling term between the bending stiffness about the principal elastic Y-axis and the torsional stiffness about the principal elastic Z-axis, as defined by the PrincipalElasticCoordinateSystem.
TorsionBendingCouplingAboutElasticYZ.markdownDescription:
TorsionBendingCouplingAboutElasticYZ: **number** (Nm/rad)

_The stiffness coupling term between the bending stiffness about the principal elastic Y-axis and the torsional stiffness about the principal elastic Z-axis, as defined by the PrincipalElasticCoordinateSystem._

Optional, Default = `0.0`

ShearStiffnessesAlongElasticXY.title: ShearStiffnessesAlongElasticXY
ShearStiffnessesAlongElasticXY.description: The shear stiffnesses along the principal elastic X- and Y-axes, as defined by the PrincipalElasticCoordinateSystem.
ShearStiffnessesAlongElasticXY.markdownDescription:
### ShearStiffnessesAlongElasticXY

_The shear stiffnesses along the principal elastic X- and Y-axes, as defined by the PrincipalElasticCoordinateSystem._

- `ShearStiffnessAlongElasticX`: **number** (N/m²)
- `ShearStiffnessAlongElasticY`: **number** (N/m²)

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

ShearStiffnessAlongElasticX.description: The shear stiffness along the principal elastic X-axis, as defined by the PrincipalElasticCoordinateSystem.
ShearStiffnessAlongElasticX.markdownDescription:

Mounting.title: Mounting
Mounting.description: The blade mounting angles, outboard of pitch bearing.
Mounting.markdownDescription:
### Mounting

_The blade mounting angles, outboard of pitch bearing._

- `ConingAngle`: **number** (rad), _Optional_
- `SweepAngle`: **number** (rad), _Optional_

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

ConingAngle.description: An additional blade coning angle applied at the root of the blade itself.  This has the effect of adding a contribution to the pre-bend deflection which increases linearly with distance along the blade. The direction of the coning follows that of the hub ConingAngle when the pitch of the blade is fine.
ConingAngle.markdownDescription:
ConingAngle: **number** (rad)

_An additional blade coning angle applied at the root of the blade itself.  This has the effect of adding a contribution to the pre-bend deflection which increases linearly with distance along the blade. The direction of the coning follows that of the hub ConingAngle when the pitch of the blade is fine._

Optional, Default = `0.0`

SweepAngle.description: The blade sweep angle, a positive sweep angle means that the blade tip is swept back from the pitch axis, away from the direction of rotation.
SweepAngle.markdownDescription:
SweepAngle: **number** (rad)

_The blade sweep angle, a positive sweep angle means that the blade tip is swept back from the pitch axis, away from the direction of rotation._

Optional, Default = `0.0`

DrivetrainAndNacelle.title: DrivetrainAndNacelle
DrivetrainAndNacelle.description: A drivetrain component.  This includes the gearbox; all shafts and brakes right up to the hub centre; the mainframe of the nacelle; all fairings and ancilliary items on the nacelle.  It excludes the generator.
DrivetrainAndNacelle.markdownDescription:
### DrivetrainAndNacelle

_A drivetrain component.  This includes the gearbox; all shafts and brakes right up to the hub centre; the mainframe of the nacelle; all fairings and ancilliary items on the nacelle.  It excludes the generator._

- _`ComponentType`_: **string = `DrivetrainAndNacelle`**
- `PositionOfHubCentre`: **object (PositionOfHubCentre)**
- `NacelleCover`: **object (NacelleCover)**, _Optional_
- `MassProperties`: **object (DrivetrainAndNacelleMassProperties)**, _Optional_
- `Sensors`: **array[object (a type of NacelleSensor)]**, _Optional_
- `ShaftBrakes`: **array[object (a type of Brake)]**, _Optional_
- `GearboxRatio`: **number**
- `GearboxInertia`: **number** (kgrad²)
- `SlippingClutch`: **object (SlippingClutch)**, _Optional_
- `HighSpeedShaftTorsion`: **object (HighSpeedShaftFlexibility)**, _Optional_
- `MountingFlexibility`: **object (PalletMountingFlexibility)**, _Optional_
- `LowSpeedShaft`: **object (LowSpeedShaft)**, _Optional_
- `Losses`: **object (MechanicalLosses)**, _Optional_
- ~~`OutputGroups`~~: **object (DrivetrainOutputGroupLibrary)**, _Optional_
- ~~`ConnectableNodes`~~: **object (DrivetrainConnectableNodes)**, _Optional_

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

A type of **Component**

ComponentType.description: Defines the specific type of Component model in use.  For a `DrivetrainAndNacelle` object, this must always be set to a value of `DrivetrainAndNacelle`.
ComponentType.markdownDescription:
ComponentType: **string = `Blade` | `DrivetrainAndNacelle` | `ExternalModuleComponent` | `FixedSpeedActiveDamper` | `Flexibility` | `IndependentPitchHub` | `Lidar` | `LinearPassiveDamper` | `PendulumDamper` | `PitchSystem` | `RigidBodyPointInertia` | `RigidBodySixbySixInertia` | `Rotation` | `Superelement` | `Tower` | `Translation` | `VariableSpeedActiveDamper` | `VariableSpeedGenerator` | `YawSystem`**

_Defines the specific type of Component model in use.  For a `DrivetrainAndNacelle` object, this must always be set to a value of `DrivetrainAndNacelle`._

---

### DrivetrainAndNacelle

_A drivetrain component.  This includes the gearbox; all shafts and brakes right up to the hub centre; the mainframe of the nacelle; all fairings and ancilliary items on the nacelle.  It excludes the generator._

- _`ComponentType`_: **string = `DrivetrainAndNacelle`**
- `PositionOfHubCentre`: **object (PositionOfHubCentre)**
- `NacelleCover`: **object (NacelleCover)**, _Optional_
- `MassProperties`: **object (DrivetrainAndNacelleMassProperties)**, _Optional_
- `Sensors`: **array[object (a type of NacelleSensor)]**, _Optional_
- `ShaftBrakes`: **array[object (a type of Brake)]**, _Optional_
- `GearboxRatio`: **number**
- `GearboxInertia`: **number** (kgrad²)
- `SlippingClutch`: **object (SlippingClutch)**, _Optional_
- `HighSpeedShaftTorsion`: **object (HighSpeedShaftFlexibility)**, _Optional_
- `MountingFlexibility`: **object (PalletMountingFlexibility)**, _Optional_
- `LowSpeedShaft`: **object (LowSpeedShaft)**, _Optional_
- `Losses`: **object (MechanicalLosses)**, _Optional_
- ~~`OutputGroups`~~: **object (DrivetrainOutputGroupLibrary)**, _Optional_
- ~~`ConnectableNodes`~~: **object (DrivetrainConnectableNodes)**, _Optional_

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

PositionOfHubCentre.title: PositionOfHubCentre
PositionOfHubCentre.description: The positioning of the hub centre.  The hub centre is the nominal point where all of the pitch axes intercept the axis of rotation, if any sweep is ignored.
PositionOfHubCentre.markdownDescription:
### PositionOfHubCentre

_The positioning of the hub centre.  The hub centre is the nominal point where all of the pitch axes intercept the axis of rotation, if any sweep is ignored._

- `RotorTilt`: **number** (rad)
- `Overhang`: **number** (m)
- `HeightOffset`: **number** (m)
- `SideOffset`: **number** (m), _Optional_

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

RotorTilt.description: The angle of the main bearing and low speed shaft to the horizontal.  A positive value will tilt the rotor upwards to face the sky.
RotorTilt.markdownDescription:
RotorTilt: **number** (rad)

_The angle of the main bearing and low speed shaft to the horizontal.  A positive value will tilt the rotor upwards to face the sky._

Overhang.description: The distance of the hub centre upwind from the `DrivetrainAndNacelle`'s origin (where the nacelle is attached to the yaw bearing or support structure). This will be considered as the vector component parallel to the `DrivetrainAndNacelle`'s x-axis if the `DrivetrainAndNacelle`'s axis system is not aligned with global X.
Overhang.markdownDescription:
Overhang: **number** (m)

_The distance of the hub centre upwind from the `DrivetrainAndNacelle`'s origin (where the nacelle is attached to the yaw bearing or support structure). This will be considered as the vector component parallel to the `DrivetrainAndNacelle`'s x-axis if the `DrivetrainAndNacelle`'s axis system is not aligned with global X._

HeightOffset.description: The distance in the `DrivetrainAndNacelle`'s Z direction between the `DrivetrainAndNacelle`'s origin (where the nacelle is attached to the yaw system or support structure) and the hub centre.
HeightOffset.markdownDescription:
HeightOffset: **number** (m)

_The distance in the `DrivetrainAndNacelle`'s Z direction between the `DrivetrainAndNacelle`'s origin (where the nacelle is attached to the yaw system or support structure) and the hub centre._

SideOffset.description: The distance in the `DrivetrainAndNacelle`'s Y direction between the `DrivetrainAndNacelle`'s origin (where the nacelle is attached to the yaw system or support structure) and the hub centre.  This is often zero or very small.
SideOffset.markdownDescription:
SideOffset: **number** (m)

_The distance in the `DrivetrainAndNacelle`'s Y direction between the `DrivetrainAndNacelle`'s origin (where the nacelle is attached to the yaw system or support structure) and the hub centre.  This is often zero or very small._

Optional, Default = `0.0`

Friction.description: The friction of the clutch once in motion.
Friction.markdownDescription:
Friction: **number** (Nm)

_The friction of the clutch once in motion._

Stiction.description: The stiction or static friction of the clutch which opposes the initial movement.
Stiction.markdownDescription:
Stiction: **number** (Nm)

_The stiction or static friction of the clutch which opposes the initial movement._

Optional

HighSpeedShaftInertia.description: The rotational inertia of the high-speed shaft up to the clutch.  This is only relevant if there is a slipping clutch present, as otherwise it can be considered part of the generator.
HighSpeedShaftInertia.markdownDescription:
HighSpeedShaftInertia: **number** (kgrad²)

_The rotational inertia of the high-speed shaft up to the clutch.  This is only relevant if there is a slipping clutch present, as otherwise it can be considered part of the generator._

Optional

This acts as a component in the Bladed assembly, and creates multibody objects to attach to the previous component.

Flexibility.title: Flexibility
Flexibility.description: A generic component representing a flexibility between two other nodes.  The proximal and distal nodes can have flexibility in up to six degrees of freedom.  The hinge is assumed to be rigid in any direction where the properties are not specified.

HubMassProperties.title: HubMassProperties
HubMassProperties.description: The mass properties of the hub.
HubMassProperties.markdownDescription:
### HubMassProperties

_The mass properties of the hub._

- `Mass`: **number** (kg)
- `AxialPositionOfCentreOfGravity`: **number** (m)
- `MomentOfInertiaAboutShaft`: **number** (kgrad²)
- `MomentOfInertiaPerpendicularToShaft`: **number** (kgrad²), _Optional_

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

Mass.description: The total mass of hub including the pitch system, but excluding contribution from the blades connected to it.
Mass.markdownDescription:
Mass: **number** (kg)

_The total mass of hub including the pitch system, but excluding contribution from the blades connected to it._

AxialPositionOfCentreOfGravity.description: The hub centre of gravity, relative to intercept of blade pitch axis and drivetrain axis (the hub centre), positive direction being along drivetrain axis towards the hub.
AxialPositionOfCentreOfGravity.markdownDescription:
AxialPositionOfCentreOfGravity: **number** (m)

_The hub centre of gravity, relative to intercept of blade pitch axis and drivetrain axis (the hub centre), positive direction being along drivetrain axis towards the hub._

MomentOfInertiaAboutShaft.description: The total moment of inertia of hub about the low speed shaft, including the pitch system but excluding contribution from the blades connected to it.
MomentOfInertiaAboutShaft.markdownDescription:
MomentOfInertiaAboutShaft: **number** (kgrad²)

_The total moment of inertia of hub about the low speed shaft, including the pitch system but excluding contribution from the blades connected to it._

MomentOfInertiaPerpendicularToShaft.description: The total moment of inertia of hub perpendicular to the low speed shaft, including the pitch system but excluding contribution from the blades connected to it.
MomentOfInertiaPerpendicularToShaft.markdownDescription:
MomentOfInertiaPerpendicularToShaft: **number** (kgrad²)

_The total moment of inertia of hub perpendicular to the low speed shaft, including the pitch system but excluding contribution from the blades connected to it._

Optional

IndependentPitchHub.title: IndependentPitchHub
IndependentPitchHub.description: A standard hub with two or more blades, and one pitch system for each blade.
IndependentPitchHub.markdownDescription:
### IndependentPitchHub

_A standard hub with two or more blades, and one pitch system for each blade._

- _`ComponentType`_: **string = `IndependentPitchHub`**
- `RotationDirection`: **string = `CLOCKWISE_VIEWED_FROM_FRONT` | `ANTICLOCKWISE_VIEWED_FROM_FRONT`**
- `UpwindOrDownwind`: **string = `UPWIND` | `DOWNWIND`**
- `MountingPoints`: **object (MountingPoints)**
- `ExtensionPieces`: **object (ExtensionPieces)**, _Optional_
- `MassProperties`: **object (HubMassProperties)**
- `Spinner`: **object (Spinner)**
- ~~`ConnectableNodes`~~: **object (HubConnectableNodes)**, _Optional_
- ~~`OutputGroups`~~: **object (HubOutputGroupLibrary)**, _Optional_
- `NumberOfBlades`: **integer**
- `Imbalances`: **object (RotorImbalances)**

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

A type of **Component**

ComponentType.description: Defines the specific type of Component model in use.  For a `IndependentPitchHub` object, this must always be set to a value of `IndependentPitchHub`.
ComponentType.markdownDescription:
ComponentType: **string = `Blade` | `DrivetrainAndNacelle` | `ExternalModuleComponent` | `FixedSpeedActiveDamper` | `Flexibility` | `IndependentPitchHub` | `Lidar` | `LinearPassiveDamper` | `PendulumDamper` | `PitchSystem` | `RigidBodyPointInertia` | `RigidBodySixbySixInertia` | `Rotation` | `Superelement` | `Tower` | `Translation` | `VariableSpeedActiveDamper` | `VariableSpeedGenerator` | `YawSystem`**

_Defines the specific type of Component model in use.  For a `IndependentPitchHub` object, this must always be set to a value of `IndependentPitchHub`._

---

### IndependentPitchHub

_A standard hub with two or more blades, and one pitch system for each blade._

- _`ComponentType`_: **string = `IndependentPitchHub`**
- `RotationDirection`: **string = `CLOCKWISE_VIEWED_FROM_FRONT` | `ANTICLOCKWISE_VIEWED_FROM_FRONT`**
- `UpwindOrDownwind`: **string = `UPWIND` | `DOWNWIND`**
- `MountingPoints`: **object (MountingPoints)**
- `ExtensionPieces`: **object (ExtensionPieces)**, _Optional_
- `MassProperties`: **object (HubMassProperties)**
- `Spinner`: **object (Spinner)**
- ~~`ConnectableNodes`~~: **object (HubConnectableNodes)**, _Optional_
- ~~`OutputGroups`~~: **object (HubOutputGroupLibrary)**, _Optional_
- `NumberOfBlades`: **integer**
- `Imbalances`: **object (RotorImbalances)**

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

A type of **Component**

MountingPoints.title: MountingPoints
MountingPoints.description: The properties defining where the blades or pitch systems attach to the hub.  All of the angles described are for INSIDE of the pitch bearing - the blade has its own values for sweep and cone outside of the pitch bearing.
MountingPoints.markdownDescription:
### MountingPoints

_The properties defining where the blades or pitch systems attach to the hub.  All of the angles described are for INSIDE of the pitch bearing - the blade has its own values for sweep and cone outside of the pitch bearing._

- `RadiusOfBladeConnection`: **number** (m)
- `ConingAngle`: **number** (rad), _Optional_
- `SetAngle`: **number** (rad), _Optional_

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

RadiusOfBladeConnection.description: The radius (measured from the hub's axis of rotation) that the extension piece terminates and the blade will commence.
RadiusOfBladeConnection.markdownDescription:
RadiusOfBladeConnection: **number** (m)

_The radius (measured from the hub's axis of rotation) that the extension piece terminates and the blade will commence._

ConingAngle.description: The coning angle of the hub itself.  A positive value for ConingAngle will result in the blade tips moving away from the nacelle, whether an upwind or downwind turbine.
ConingAngle.markdownDescription:
ConingAngle: **number** (rad)

_The coning angle of the hub itself.  A positive value for ConingAngle will result in the blade tips moving away from the nacelle, whether an upwind or downwind turbine._

Optional, Default = `0.0`

SetAngle.description: The angle at which the pitch bearings or blades are mounted onto the pitch bearing or hub.  When the set angle is 0, the blade root Y-axis (which is broadly aligned with the chord-line) will lie in the plane of the rotor (when cone angle is ignored).  More positive values of set angle push the leading edge further upstream.
SetAngle.markdownDescription:
SetAngle: **number** (rad)

_The angle at which the pitch bearings or blades are mounted onto the pitch bearing or hub.  When the set angle is 0, the blade root Y-axis (which is broadly aligned with the chord-line) will lie in the plane of the rotor (when cone angle is ignored).  More positive values of set angle push the leading edge further upstream._

Optional, Default = `0.0`

RotorImbalances.title: RotorImbalances
RotorImbalances.description: The definition of any imbalances on the hub.
RotorImbalances.markdownDescription:
### RotorImbalances

_The definition of any imbalances on the hub._

- `OutOfBalanceMass`: **number** (kg)
- `RadiusOfMass`: **number** (m)
- `AzimuthalPositionOfMass`: **number** (rad)
- `ErrorsInSetAngle`: **array[number]** (rad), _Optional_
- `ErrorsInAzimuthAngle`: **array[number]** (rad), _Optional_

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

OutOfBalanceMass.description: A mass to add off the centreline of the hub to represent the various mass imbalances and assymetries in the rotor.
OutOfBalanceMass.markdownDescription:
OutOfBalanceMass: **number** (kg)

_A mass to add off the centreline of the hub to represent the various mass imbalances and assymetries in the rotor._

RadiusOfMass.description: The radial location of the mass to add off the centreline of the hub to represent the various mass imbalances and assymetries in the rotor.
RadiusOfMass.markdownDescription:
RadiusOfMass: **number** (m)

_The radial location of the mass to add off the centreline of the hub to represent the various mass imbalances and assymetries in the rotor._

AzimuthalPositionOfMass.description: The angular location of the mass to add off the centreline of the hub to represent the various mass imbalances and assymetries in the rotor.
AzimuthalPositionOfMass.markdownDescription:
AzimuthalPositionOfMass: **number** (rad)

_The angular location of the mass to add off the centreline of the hub to represent the various mass imbalances and assymetries in the rotor._

ErrorsInSetAngle.description: The manufacturing or assembly errors in the angle the pitch bearings or blades are attached to the hub.
ErrorsInSetAngle.markdownDescription:
ErrorsInSetAngle: **array[number]** (rad)

_The manufacturing or assembly errors in the angle the pitch bearings or blades are attached to the hub._

Optional

ErrorsInAzimuthAngle.description: The manufacturing or assembly errors in the azimuth angle for each blade mounting point.
ErrorsInAzimuthAngle.markdownDescription:
ErrorsInAzimuthAngle: **array[number]** (rad)

_The manufacturing or assembly errors in the azimuth angle for each blade mounting point._

Optional

Spinner.title: Spinner
Spinner.description: The aerodynamic fairing covering the hub structure.
Spinner.markdownDescription:
### Spinner

_The aerodynamic fairing covering the hub structure._

- `Diameter`: **number** (m)

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

Diameter.description: The diameter of the fairing at its widest point.
Diameter.markdownDescription:
Diameter: **number** (m)

_The diameter of the fairing at its widest point._

RotationDirection.description: The rotational sense of rotor when viewed from upwind.
RotationDirection.markdownDescription:
RotationDirection: **string = `CLOCKWISE_VIEWED_FROM_FRONT` | `ANTICLOCKWISE_VIEWED_FROM_FRONT`**

_The rotational sense of rotor when viewed from upwind._

UpwindOrDownwind.description: Whether the turbine is an upwind turbine (where the rotor is upwind of the nacelle) or a downwind turbine (where the rotor is downwind of the nacelle).
UpwindOrDownwind.markdownDescription:
UpwindOrDownwind: **string = `UPWIND` | `DOWNWIND`**

_Whether the turbine is an upwind turbine (where the rotor is upwind of the nacelle) or a downwind turbine (where the rotor is downwind of the nacelle)._

MountingPoints.description: The properties defining where the blades or pitch systems attach to the hub.  All of the angles described are for INSIDE of the pitch bearing - the blade has its own values for sweep and cone outside of the pitch bearing.
MountingPoints.markdownDescription:
MountingPoints: **object (MountingPoints)**

_The properties defining where the blades or pitch systems attach to the hub.  All of the angles described are for INSIDE of the pitch bearing - the blade has its own values for sweep and cone outside of the pitch bearing._

ExtensionPieces.description: The definition of the extension pieces which connect the pitch systems within the hub to the blades.  These are assumed to all be the same.
ExtensionPieces.markdownDescription:
ExtensionPieces: **object (ExtensionPieces)**

_The definition of the extension pieces which connect the pitch systems within the hub to the blades.  These are assumed to all be the same._

Optional

MassProperties.description: The mass properties of the hub.
MassProperties.markdownDescription:
MassProperties: **object (HubMassProperties)**

_The mass properties of the hub._

Spinner.description: The properties of the spinner (the aerodynamic fairing of the hub).
Spinner.markdownDescription:
Spinner: **object (Spinner)**

_The properties of the spinner (the aerodynamic fairing of the hub)._

ConnectableNodes.description: A library of nodes that other components can attach to.  These will be used to build the model, and can be referenced by the Assembly.  The details of what the nodes actually represent (such as their internal node names) will be unavailable if the component is encrypted, but other users will be able to see and reference the nodes by their name.
ConnectableNodes.markdownDescription:
ConnectableNodes: **object (HubConnectableNodes)**

_**Not supported yet**_

_A library of nodes that other components can attach to.  These will be used to build the model, and can be referenced by the Assembly.  The details of what the nodes actually represent (such as their internal node names) will be unavailable if the component is encrypted, but other users will be able to see and reference the nodes by their name._

Optional

OutputGroups.description: A library of output regimes which can be referenced by the simulation.  The details of what will be output will be unavailable if the component is encrypted, but other users will be able to see and reference the output group names.
OutputGroups.markdownDescription:
OutputGroups: **object (HubOutputGroupLibrary)**

_**Not supported yet**_

_A library of output regimes which can be referenced by the simulation.  The details of what will be output will be unavailable if the component is encrypted, but other users will be able to see and reference the output group names._

Optional

NumberOfBlades.description: The number of blades on the hub.
NumberOfBlades.markdownDescription:
NumberOfBlades: **integer**

_The number of blades on the hub._

Imbalances.description: The definition of any imbalances on the hub.
Imbalances.markdownDescription:
Imbalances: **object (RotorImbalances)**

_The definition of any imbalances on the hub._

WeightingFunction.description: The relationship between the distance from the focal point and the weighting to put on the sample.  Every Lidar sampling point has a finite width, where velocities are collected to either side of the nominal focal distance.  This relationship is used to put more weight on those samples closest to the nominal focal point.
WeightingFunction.markdownDescription:
WeightingFunction: **array[object (LookUpTableElement)]**

_**Not supported yet**_

Every Lidar sampling point has a finite width, where velocities are collected to either side of the nominal focal distance.  This relationship is used to put more weight on those samples closest to the nominal focal point._

CircularLidarScan.title: CircularLidarScan
CircularLidarScan.markdownDescription:

RosetteLidarScan.title: RosetteLidarScan
RosetteLidarScan.description: A petal-shaped scan pattern, passing through several 'lobes' as it circles the centreline.
RosetteLidarScan.markdownDescription:

- ~~`MaximumHalfAngle`~~: **number** (rad)
- ~~`MinimumHalfAngle`~~: **number** (rad)
- ~~`NumberOfLobes`~~: **integer**, _Optional_

or

- ~~`$insert`~~: **string (URI-reference)**

MaximumHalfAngle.description: The half-angle to the outermost extent of each lob.

_**Not supported yet**_

MinimumHalfAngle.description: The half-angle to the innermost extent of each lob.

Optional, Default = `1`

_**Not supported yet**_

DistanceFromFocalPoint.description: The distance either side of the nominal focal distance that the sample was collected from.  If there isn't a value provided for a distance of 0.0, the weighting will be assumed to be 1.0 (100%).
DistanceFromFocalPoint.markdownDescription:
DistanceFromFocalPoint: **number** (m)

_**Not supported yet**_

_The distance either side of the nominal focal distance that the sample was collected from.  If there isn't a value provided for a distance of 0.0, the weighting will be assumed to be 1.0 (100%)._

ProportionOfSignal.description: The proportion of the signal to take at the corresponding distance from the nominal focal distance, also known as the weighting.  This should range from 1.0 (100%) down to 0.0 (0%).
ProportionOfSignal.markdownDescription:
ProportionOfSignal: **number**

_**Not supported yet**_

_The proportion of the signal to take at the corresponding distance from the nominal focal distance, also known as the weighting.  This should range from 1.0 (100%) down to 0.0 (0%)._

Friction.title: Friction
Friction.description: The friction characteristics of the pitch system's bearing.
Friction.markdownDescription:
### Friction

_The friction characteristics of the pitch system's bearing._

- `BearingFriction`: **object (PitchBearingKineticFriction)**
- `BearingStiction`: **object (PitchBearingStiction)**, _Optional_

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

BearingFriction.description: The torque resisting movement, once the bearing is in motion.
BearingFriction.markdownDescription:
BearingFriction: **object (PitchBearingKineticFriction)**

_The torque resisting movement, once the bearing is in motion._

BearingStiction.description: The additional torque resisting the initial movement of the bearing.
BearingStiction.markdownDescription:
BearingStiction: **object (PitchBearingStiction)**

_The additional torque resisting the initial movement of the bearing._

Optional

or

FrictionTorquePerUnitRate.markdownDescription:
FrictionTorquePerUnitRate: **number**

_A fixed ratio between the rate at which the bearing is turning and the friction opposing the motion._

ProportionalGain.description: The gain on the contemporaneous error.
ProportionalGain.markdownDescription:
ProportionalGain: **number** (Hz)

_The gain on the contemporaneous error._

Optional, Default = `0`

IntegralGain.description: The gain on the integral from time zero till the present of the error signal.
IntegralGain.markdownDescription:
IntegralGain: **number** (/s²)

_The gain on the integral from time zero till the present of the error signal._

Optional, Default = `0`

DifferentialGain.description: The gain the filtered derivative of the error.  The derivative of the error is passed through a low-pass filter.
DifferentialGain.markdownDescription:
DifferentialGain: **number**

_The gain the filtered derivative of the error.  The derivative of the error is passed through a low-pass filter._

Optional, Default = `0`

SecondaryRateResponse.description: If omitted, it will be assumed that the rate will respond immediately to any demands from the position PID control.
SecondaryRateResponse.markdownDescription:
SecondaryRateResponse: **object (a type of ResponseToSecondaryRateDemand)**

_If omitted, it will be assumed that the rate will respond immediately to any demands from the position PID control._

Optional

**ResponseToSecondaryRateDemand** types: `FirstOrderSecondaryRateResponse`, `ProportionalIntegralDeriviativeForSecondaryRate`, `SecondOrderSecondaryRateResponse`

DifferentialGainAction.description: The proportional and integral terms are applied on error.  Derivative term may also be applied on the feedback or setpoint signals.
DifferentialGainAction.markdownDescription:
DifferentialGainAction: **string = `Error` | `Feedback` | `Setpoint`**

_The proportional and integral terms are applied on error.  Derivative term may also be applied on the feedback or setpoint signals._

Optional, Default = `Feedback`

DifferentialGainTimeConstant.description: The derivative term uses a low-pass filter on input.
DifferentialGainTimeConstant.markdownDescription:
DifferentialGainTimeConstant: **number** (s)

_The derivative term uses a low-pass filter on input._

Optional, Default = `0`

DesaturationTimeConstant.description: The time constant for when the output exceeds the limits.
DesaturationTimeConstant.markdownDescription:
DesaturationTimeConstant: **number** (s)

_The time constant for when the output exceeds the limits._

Optional, Default = `0`

### ProportionalIntegralDeriviativeForRate

_Defines an proportional, integral, deriviative (PID) response to the controller's demands._

- `DifferentialGain`: **number**, _Optional_
- `DifferentialGainAction`: **string = `Error` | `Feedback` | `Setpoint`**, _Optional_

- `DesaturationTimeConstant`: **number** (s), _Optional_

or

A type of **ResponseToRateDemand**

_The gain on the contemporaneous error._

Optional, Default = `0`

IntegralGain.description: The gain on the integral from time zero till the present of the error signal.
IntegralGain.markdownDescription:
IntegralGain: **number** (/s²)

_The gain on the integral from time zero till the present of the error signal._

Optional, Default = `0`

DifferentialGain.description: The gain the filtered derivative of the error.  The derivative of the error is passed through a low-pass filter.
DifferentialGain.markdownDescription:
DifferentialGain: **number**

_The gain the filtered derivative of the error.  The derivative of the error is passed through a low-pass filter._

Optional, Default = `0`

Optional, Default = `Feedback`

DifferentialGainTimeConstant.description: The derivative term uses a low-pass filter on input.
DifferentialGainTimeConstant.markdownDescription:
DifferentialGainTimeConstant: **number** (s)

Optional, Default = `0`

DesaturationTimeConstant.description: The time constant for when the output exceeds the limits.

Optional, Default = `0`

StructuralModes.description: List of included modes and their associated damping ratios. The presence of any of these objects in the StructuralModes list indicates that the mode should be calculated, even if it does not include a DampingRatio. If no modes are provided, the structure will be considered rigid. Users can add any metadata alongside the DampingRatio, such as _Name or _Mode. Bladed will disregard any metadata as long as it is prefixed with an underscore.
StructuralModes.markdownDescription:
StructuralModes: **array[object (StructuralMode)]**

_List of included modes and their associated damping ratios. The presence of any of these objects in the StructuralModes list indicates that the mode should be calculated, even if it does not include a DampingRatio. If no modes are provided, the structure will be considered rigid. Users can add any metadata alongside the DampingRatio, such as \_Name or \_Mode. Bladed will disregard any metadata as long as it is prefixed with an underscore._
