A type of **Wind**

MeanSpeed.description: The mean wind speed upon which the turbulence will be added.  This must correspond with the mean wind speed used to create the turbulence file.
MeanSpeed.markdownDescription:
MeanSpeed: **number** (m/s)

_The mean wind speed upon which the turbulence will be added.  This must correspond with the mean wind speed used to create the turbulence file._

TurbulenceFilepath.description: The filepath or URI of the turbulence file.
TurbulenceFilepath.markdownDescription:
TurbulenceFilepath: **string (URI-reference)**

_The filepath or URI of the turbulence file._

TurbulenceIntensity.description: The turbulence intensity in the longitudinal (global X) direction.  This is used to scale the turbulence provided in the file.
TurbulenceIntensity.markdownDescription:
TurbulenceIntensity: **number**

_The turbulence intensity in the longitudinal (global X) direction.  This is used to scale the turbulence provided in the file._

TurbulenceIntensityLateral.description: The turbulence intensity in the lateral (global Y) direction.  This is typically in the order of 80% of the longitudinal turbulence intensity.
TurbulenceIntensityLateral.markdownDescription:
TurbulenceIntensityLateral: **number**

_The turbulence intensity in the lateral (global Y) direction.  This is typically in the order of 80% of the longitudinal turbulence intensity._

TurbulenceIntensityVertical.description: The turbulence intensity in the vertical (global Z) direction.  This is typically in the order of 50% of the longitudinal turbulence intensity.
TurbulenceIntensityVertical.markdownDescription:
TurbulenceIntensityVertical: **number**

_The turbulence intensity in the vertical (global Z) direction.  This is typically in the order of 50% of the longitudinal turbulence intensity._

CentreTurbulenceFileOn.description: The method used to position the data in the turbulence file relative to the turbine.  If any part of the rotor exceeds this box, the simulation will terminate with an exception.
CentreTurbulenceFileOn.markdownDescription:
CentreTurbulenceFileOn: **string = `CENTRED_ON_HUB` | `BEST_FIT`**

_The method used to position the data in the turbulence file relative to the turbine.  If any part of the rotor exceeds this box, the simulation will terminate with an exception._

Optional

CentreTurbulenceFileAtHeight.description: The height at which to centre the data in the turbulence file.  If any part of the rotor exceeds this box, the simulation will terminate with an exception.
CentreTurbulenceFileAtHeight.markdownDescription:
CentreTurbulenceFileAtHeight: **number** (m)

_The height at which to centre the data in the turbulence file.  If any part of the rotor exceeds this box, the simulation will terminate with an exception._

Optional

InterpolationMethod.description: The method used to interpolate the wind speed in between the provided turbulence locations.
InterpolationMethod.markdownDescription:
InterpolationMethod: **string = `LINEAR` | `CUBIC_IN_ROTOR_PLANE` | `ALL_CUBIC`**

_The method used to interpolate the wind speed in between the provided turbulence locations._

Optional, Default = `ALL_CUBIC`

EvolvingTurbulence.description: The settings for evolving turbulence, if required.  In the case of a normal turbulent wind field, the turbulence is "frozen" and approaches the turbine at a constant block.  Although this doesn't match physical reality, it is a particular problem for Lidar - as it gives them a completely deterministic insight into the oncoming wind field.  In order to represent the nature of real turbulence, a second turbulence file is superimposed on the wind field so that it "evolves" as it moves forward.  This is applied only to the Lidar readings, to provide a contrast between what the wind field might be at the sampling point and what it is once it reaches the turbine itself.
EvolvingTurbulence.markdownDescription:
EvolvingTurbulence: **object (a type of EvolvingTurbulence)**

_The settings for evolving turbulence, if required.  In the case of a normal turbulent wind field, the turbulence is "frozen" and approaches the turbine at a constant block.  Although this doesn't match physical reality, it is a particular problem for Lidar - as it gives them a completely deterministic insight into the oncoming wind field.  In order to represent the nature of real turbulence, a second turbulence file is superimposed on the wind field so that it "evolves" as it moves forward.  This is applied only to the Lidar readings, to provide a contrast between what the wind field might be at the sampling point and what it is once it reaches the turbine itself._

Optional

**EvolvingTurbulence** types: `EvolvingTurbulenceExponential`, `EvolvingTurbulenceKristensen`

TurbulenceFileStartTime.description: The time into turbulent wind file at start of simulation.  This can be used to synchronise the wind file with simulation.
TurbulenceFileStartTime.markdownDescription:
TurbulenceFileStartTime: **number** (s)

_The time into turbulent wind file at start of simulation.  This can be used to synchronise the wind file with simulation._

Optional, Default = `0.0`

DirectionShear.description: The direction shear, otherwise known as "wind veer".  This models the case where the direction of the wind field varies as the height increases.
DirectionShear.markdownDescription:
DirectionShear: **number** (rad/m)

_The direction shear, otherwise known as "wind veer".  This models the case where the direction of the wind field varies as the height increases._

Optional, Default = `0.0`

PresetWindDirectionShearTransient.title: PresetWindDirectionShearTransient
PresetWindDirectionShearTransient.description: A preset transient in the vertical direction shear (wind veer).  This is a linear relationship between the height and the local direction, with the direction being its nominal value at the reference height.
PresetWindDirectionShearTransient.markdownDescription:
### PresetWindDirectionShearTransient

_A preset transient in the vertical direction shear (wind veer).  This is a linear relationship between the height and the local direction, with the direction being its nominal value at the reference height._

- _`DirectionShearVariationType`_: **string = `PresetTransient`**
- `DirectionShearAtStart`: **number** (rad/m)
- `AmplitudeOfVariation`: **number** (rad/m)
- `StartTime`: **number** (s)
- `DurationOfVariation`: **number** (s)
- `VariationShape`: **string = `FULL` | `HALF` | `IEC-2`**

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

A type of **DirectionShearVariation**

DirectionShearVariationType.description: Defines the specific type of DirectionShearVariation model in use.  For a `PresetTransient` object, this must always be set to a value of `PresetTransient`.
DirectionShearVariationType.markdownDescription:
DirectionShearVariationType: **string = `PresetTransient` | `TimeHistory`**

_Defines the specific type of DirectionShearVariation model in use.  For a `PresetTransient` object, this must always be set to a value of `PresetTransient`._

---

### PresetWindDirectionShearTransient

_A preset transient in the vertical direction shear (wind veer).  This is a linear relationship between the height and the local direction, with the direction being its nominal value at the reference height._

- _`DirectionShearVariationType`_: **string = `PresetTransient`**
- `DirectionShearAtStart`: **number** (rad/m)

DirectionShearAtStart: **number** (rad/m)

_The vertical direction shear at the start of the simulation up to the beginning of the transient.  For a full cycle this will also be the value after the transient has completed._

StartTime: **number** (s)

_The time into the simulation at which to start the transient (excluding the lead-in time)._

DurationOfVariation.description: The time taken to complete the transient, whether half-cycle or full-cycle.

DurationOfVariation: **number** (s)

VariationShape: **string = `FULL` | `HALF` | `IEC-2`**

ReferenceHeight.markdownDescription:

Optional

Optional

Inclination.description: The inclination of the flow relative to the horizontal plane.  Typically this is in the order of 8 degrees for an onshore turbine, and 0 degrees for an offshore turbine.
Inclination.markdownDescription:

SteadyWakeDeficit.markdownDescription:
SteadyWakeDeficit: **object (a type of SteadyWakeDeficit)**

_A simple model for the reduced velocity of the wind behind another turbine.  This deficit will be applied across a certain region, and this region will not move around during the simulation._

Optional

**SteadyWakeDeficit** types: `Gaussian`, `UserDefined`

DynamicUpstreamWake.description: The representation of an upwind turbine's wake impinging on the simulated turbine.  This can include meandering wake, where the velocity deficit moves around relative to the simulated turbine.
DynamicUpstreamWake.markdownDescription:
DynamicUpstreamWake: **object (DynamicUpstreamWake)**

_The representation of an upwind turbine's wake impinging on the simulated turbine.  This can include meandering wake, where the velocity deficit moves around relative to the simulated turbine._

Optional

or

EventType: **string = `ControllerFault` | `EmergencyStopOperation` | `GridLoss` | `NetworkFrequencyDisturbance` | `NetworkVoltageDisturbance` | `NormalStopOperation` | `PermanentlyStuckPitchSystem` | `PitchFaultConstantRate` | `PitchFaultConstantTorque` | `PitchFaultLimp` | `PitchFaultSeizure` | `PitchFaultSeizureAtAngle` | `ShortCircuit` | `StartUpOperation` | `YawFaultConstantRate` | `YawFaultConstantTorque` | `YawFaultLimp` | `YawManoeuvre`**

ExternallySteppedSimulation.title: ExternallySteppedSimulation
ExternallySteppedSimulation.description: The definition of a Bladed real time simulation.  This will be run with Bladed as an external library (i.e. a dynamic link library (dll) on Windows, or a shared object (so) on Linux).  An external process must call functions within the Bladed external library to "step" the simulation, and thereby keep it synchronised with the external controlling process.

If omitted, Bladed will attempt to determine a combination of generator torque and pitch angle that would result in the rotor operating at a constant speed.  Once the simulation begins, environmental and control changes can result in this speed changing unless MaintainInitialValueThroughoutSimulation is true._

Optional

MaintainInitialValueThroughoutSimulation.description: If true, the rotor speed will be prescribed to maintain whatever speed was determined during initial conditions.  This cannot be overcome by aerodynamic loads or other physical forces, and the generator torque will become irrelevant.

TimeDomainSimulation.title: TimeDomainSimulation
TimeDomainSimulation.description: The definition of a time domain analysis - mutually exclusive with 'SteadyCalculation'
TimeDomainSimulation.markdownDescription:
### TimeDomainSimulation

_The definition of a time domain analysis - mutually exclusive with 'SteadyCalculation'_

- `Duration`: **number** (s)
- `LeadInTime`: **number** (s), _Optional_
- `Outputs`: **object (TimeDomainOutputs)**

- ~~`AppliedLoads`~~: **array[object (a type of AppliedLoad)]**, _Optional_

- `Events`: **array[object (a type of Event)]**, _Optional_

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

Duration.description: The duration of the simulation for which results will be output, excluding the LeadInTime. SI units are seconds.
Duration.markdownDescription:
Duration: **number** (s)

_The duration of the simulation for which results will be output, excluding the LeadInTime. SI units are seconds._

LeadInTime.description: The time that the simulation will run before any outputs are recorded.  This is to allow the simulation to "settle", allowing any non-equilibrium initial conditions to converge on their steady state values.  The lead-in time will be added to the duration, meaning that the duration will be the length of time the outputs are recorded for.  Any times specified within the simulation will be measured from the *end* of the lead-in period.
LeadInTime.markdownDescription:
LeadInTime: **number** (s)

_The time that the simulation will run before any outputs are recorded.  This is to allow the simulation to "settle", allowing any non-equilibrium initial conditions to converge on their steady state values.  The lead-in time will be added to the duration, meaning that the duration will be the length of time the outputs are recorded for.  Any times specified within the simulation will be measured from the *end* of the lead-in period._

Optional, Default = `0.0`

Outputs.description: The definition outputs to write for this simulation.
Outputs.markdownDescription:
Outputs: **object (TimeDomainOutputs)**

_The definition outputs to write for this simulation._

AdditionalExternalModules.description: A list of external module that will be used for this simulation only.  This could be used to apply loading to the structure, or some other load case specific purpose.  If the external module is seeking to simulate an intrinsic property of the turbine, consider moving it into the GlobalExternalModules, or adding it to the Assembly tree.
AdditionalExternalModules.markdownDescription:
AdditionalExternalModules: **array[object (ExternalModule)]**

_A list of external module that will be used for this simulation only.  This could be used to apply loading to the structure, or some other load case specific purpose.  If the external module is seeking to simulate an intrinsic property of the turbine, consider moving it into the GlobalExternalModules, or adding it to the Assembly tree._

Optional

ExternallySteppedSimulation.description: The definition of a Bladed real time simulation.  This will be run with Bladed as an external library (i.e. a dynamic link library (dll) on Windows, or a shared object (so) on Linux).  An external process must call functions within the Bladed external library to "step" the simulation, and thereby keep it synchronised with the external controlling process.

_**Not supported yet**_

Assembly.title: Assembly
Assembly.description:
The Assembly is a tree structure defining the connectivity of the turbine components.
Each node in the tree is defined as an object with a custom name, and a reference to the relevant component in the ComponentDefinitions.
Each node can have 0 or more connected 'child' nodes, defined as object properties inside it.
The Assembly tree must start with a single node at the root.

additionalProperties.description:
The Assembly is a tree structure defining the connectivity of the turbine components. 
Each node in the tree is defined as an object with a custom name, and a reference to the relevant component in the ComponentDefinitions.
additionalProperties.markdownDescription:
_0..n_ <custom-name>: **object (AssemblyNode)**

_The Assembly is a tree structure defining the connectivity of the turbine components._

_Each node in the tree is defined as an object with a custom name, and a reference to the relevant component in the ComponentDefinitions._

Hub._comment: This is the single root node, for a hub component, under which 3 'child' nodes have been defined, modelling the pitch system and blades.

PitchSystem1._comment: Each child node itself, references it's component, and can have an unbounded number of 'child' nodes.

AssemblyNode.title: AssemblyNode
AssemblyNode.description:
A node in the turbine assembly tree, defining the connectivity of all the turbine components. 
Each node is included in the tree with a custom name, and a reference to the relevant component in the ComponentDefinitions.
AssemblyNode.markdownDescription:
### AssemblyNode

_A node in the turbine assembly tree, defining the connectivity of all the turbine components._

_Each node is included in the tree with a custom name, and a reference to the relevant component in the ComponentDefinitions._

- `@Definition`: **string (ComponentLibraryKey)**
- `ConnectedToNode`: **integer**, _Optional_
- _0..n_`<custom-name>`: **object (AssemblyNode)**

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

@Definition.description:
Specifies the component definition for this node, using the key of the component definition in the ComponentLibrary.

e.g. `ComponentLibrary.blade`

additionalProperties.description: An AssemblyNode connected to the current node. Each AssemblyNode can have as many named children as its Component has available ConnectableNodes.
additionalProperties.markdownDescription:
_0..n_ <custom-name>: **object (AssemblyNode)**

_An AssemblyNode connected to the current node. Each AssemblyNode can have as many named children as its Component has available ConnectableNodes._

BladedControl.title: BladedControl
BladedControl.description: A definition of how the turbine is controlled.
BladedControl.markdownDescription:
### BladedControl

or

SignalProperties.description: The noise and transducer properties for those signals representing values coming from a physical sensor.
SignalProperties.markdownDescription:

_**Not supported yet**_

Optional

ControlDiscreteTimeStep.description: The minimum timestep to be used across all of the controllers.  Controllers do not need to be called on every timestep (see the 'TimeStepMultiplier' parameter, below).
ControlDiscreteTimeStep.markdownDescription:
ControlDiscreteTimeStep: **number** (s)

_The minimum timestep to be used across all of the controllers.  Controllers do not need to be called on every timestep (see the 'TimeStepMultiplier' parameter, below)._

Optional, Default = `0.1`

Controllers.description: A list of externally-defined controllers.  These will be run in the order they are specified, but can be run at different multiples of the timestep set above.  If no controllers are specified, there will be no control action taken throughout the simulation.  No control demands will be calculated or acted upon, although the rotor speed may well accelerate.  The friction of the pitch systems may also be overcome, resulting in a change in the pitch angles.
Controllers.markdownDescription:
Controllers: **array[object (ExternalController)]**

_A list of externally-defined controllers.  These will be run in the order they are specified, but can be run at different multiples of the timestep set above.  If no controllers are specified, there will be no control action taken throughout the simulation.  No control demands will be calculated or acted upon, although the rotor speed may well accelerate.  The friction of the pitch systems may also be overcome, resulting in a change in the pitch angles._

Optional

SafetySystem.description: The definition of the turbine's safety system.  This supersedes the turbine's controller requests.
SafetySystem.markdownDescription:
SafetySystem: **object (SafetySystem)**

_**Not supported yet**_

_The definition of the turbine's safety system.  This supersedes the turbine's controller requests._

Optional

ExternalController.title: ExternalController
ExternalController.description: A definition of a single controller for the turbine.
ExternalController.markdownDescription:
### ExternalController

_A definition of a single controller for the turbine._

- `Filepath`: **string (URI-reference)**
- `CallingConvention`: **string = `__cdecl` | `__stdcall`**, _Optional_
- `PassParametersByFile`: **boolean**, _Optional_
- `ForceLegacy`: **boolean**, _Optional_
- `TimeStepMultiplier`: **string = `Every` | `Second` | `Third` | `Fourth` | `Fifth` | `Sixth` | `Seventh` | `Eigth` | `Ninth` | `Tenth`**, _Optional_
- `ParametersAsString`: **string**, _Optional_
- `ParametersAsJson`: **object**, _Optional_
- `UseFloatingPointProtection`: **boolean**, _Optional_

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

Filepath.description: The location of the external controller dll.
Filepath.markdownDescription:
Filepath: **string (URI-reference)**

_The location of the external controller dll._

CallingConvention.description: The calling convention to be used when calling the external controller.  The default for all C-family languages is '__cdecl'.  The default for FORTRAN is '__stdcall' unless the [C] qualifier is specfied immediately after the function name.  Specifying the wrong calling convention can lead to unexplained system exceptions when attempting to call the external controller.
CallingConvention.markdownDescription:
CallingConvention: **string = `__cdecl` | `__stdcall`**

_The calling convention to be used when calling the external controller.  The default for all C-family languages is '\_\_cdecl'.  The default for FORTRAN is '\_\_stdcall' unless the [C] qualifier is specfied immediately after the function name.  Specifying the wrong calling convention can lead to unexplained system exceptions when attempting to call the external controller._

Optional, Default = `__cdecl`

PassParametersByFile.description: If true, a file will be written containing the parameters in the above box.  The location of this file can be obtained in the external controller using the function GetInfileFilepath.  The name of this file will be "DISCON.IN" if there is only one controller, or of the pattern "DISCONn.IN", where 'n' is the number of the controller.  If not checked (the default), this string will be directly available using the function GetUserParameters.
PassParametersByFile.markdownDescription:
PassParametersByFile: **boolean**

_If true, a file will be written containing the parameters in the above box.  The location of this file can be obtained in the external controller using the function GetInfileFilepath.  The name of this file will be "DISCON.IN" if there is only one controller, or of the pattern "DISCONn.IN", where 'n' is the number of the controller.  If not checked (the default), this string will be directly available using the function GetUserParameters._

Optional, Default = `false`

ForceLegacy.description: If true, only the old-style 'DISCON' function will be looked for in the controller, and raise an error if it cannot be found.  This is only used for testing legacy controllers where both CONTROLLER and DISCON functions are both defined, but the DISCON function is required.
ForceLegacy.markdownDescription:
ForceLegacy: **boolean**

_If true, only the old-style 'DISCON' function will be looked for in the controller, and raise an error if it cannot be found.  This is only used for testing legacy controllers where both CONTROLLER and DISCON functions are both defined, but the DISCON function is required._

Optional, Default = `false`

TimeStepMultiplier.description: Whether the controller should be called on every discrete timestep, set above.
TimeStepMultiplier.markdownDescription:
TimeStepMultiplier: **string = `Every` | `Second` | `Third` | `Fourth` | `Fifth` | `Sixth` | `Seventh` | `Eigth` | `Ninth` | `Tenth`**

_Whether the controller should be called on every discrete timestep, set above._

Optional, Default = `Every`

ParametersAsString.description: A string that will be passed to the external controller.
ParametersAsString.markdownDescription:
ParametersAsString: **string**

_A string that will be passed to the external controller._

Optional

ParametersAsJson.description: A JSON object that will be serialised as a string and passed to the external controller.
ParametersAsJson.markdownDescription:
ParametersAsJson: **object**

_A JSON object that will be serialised as a string and passed to the external controller._

Optional

UseFloatingPointProtection.description: If true, this will apply floating point protection when calling the external controllers.  When the protection is on, any floating point errors are trapped and reported.  When this is switched off, the behaviour will default to that of the computer's floating point machine, but this can often be to not report the error, and to use a semi-random (but often very large) number instead of the correct result.  This can lead to unrepeatable results and numeric errors.
UseFloatingPointProtection.markdownDescription:
UseFloatingPointProtection: **boolean**

_If true, this will apply floating point protection when calling the external controllers.  When the protection is on, any floating point errors are trapped and reported.  When this is switched off, the behaviour will default to that of the computer's floating point machine, but this can often be to not report the error, and to use a semi-random (but often very large) number instead of the correct result.  This can lead to unrepeatable results and numeric errors._

Optional, Default = `true`

MeasuredSignalProperties.title: MeasuredSignalProperties
MeasuredSignalProperties.description: The noise and transducer properties for those signals representing values coming from a physical sensor.
MeasuredSignalProperties.markdownDescription:

_**Not supported yet**_

RandomNumberSeed.description: A seed for the random number generator to ensure that subsequent runs have identical noise signatures.
RandomNumberSeed.markdownDescription:
RandomNumberSeed: **integer**

_**Not supported yet**_

_A seed for the random number generator to ensure that subsequent runs have identical noise signatures._

Optional, Default = `0`

TurnOffNoise.description: This allows the noise to be turned off globally.  Note: this turns off noise, but keeps discretisation, sampling time, faults and transducer behaviour.
TurnOffNoise.markdownDescription:
TurnOffNoise: **boolean**

_**Not supported yet**_

_This allows the noise to be turned off globally.  Note: this turns off noise, but keeps discretisation, sampling time, faults and transducer behaviour._

Optional, Default = `false`

MaximumGeneratorTorque.description: The maximum generator torque while the energy sink is active after grid loss has occurred.  This limit is applied to generator torque demand in addition to the maximum torque demand specified in the generator model parameters.
MaximumGeneratorTorque.markdownDescription:
MaximumGeneratorTorque: **number** (Nm)

_**Not supported yet**_

_The maximum generator torque while the energy sink is active after grid loss has occurred.  This limit is applied to generator torque demand in addition to the maximum torque demand specified in the generator model parameters._

Optional, Default = `0.0`

EnergyCapacityOfSink.description: The total generator mechanical input energy which can be absorbed before generator torque falls to zero following grid loss.  In a multi-rotor turbine, this is the energy capacity per rotor.
EnergyCapacityOfSink.markdownDescription:
EnergyCapacityOfSink: **number** (J)

_**Not supported yet**_

_The total generator mechanical input energy which can be absorbed before generator torque falls to zero following grid loss.  In a multi-rotor turbine, this is the energy capacity per rotor._

Default = `0.0`

Turbine.title: Turbine
Turbine.description: The definition of the turbine and its installation that is to be modelled.
Turbine.markdownDescription:
### Turbine

_The definition of the turbine and its installation that is to be modelled._

- ~~`ElectricalGrid`~~: **object (ElectricalGrid)**, _Optional_
- `TurbineOperationalParameters`: **object (TurbineOperationalParameters)**
- `Control`: **object (BladedControl)**, _Optional_
- ~~`GlobalExternalModules`~~: **array[object (ExternalModule)]**, _Optional_
- ~~`MeanSeaLevel`~~: **number** (m), _Optional_
- `Assembly`: **object (Assembly)**
- `ComponentLibrary`: **object (ComponentLibrary)**

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

ElectricalGrid.description: The properties of the electrical grid that the turbine is connected to.
ElectricalGrid.markdownDescription:
ElectricalGrid: **object (ElectricalGrid)**

_**Not supported yet**_

_The properties of the electrical grid that the turbine is connected to._

Optional

TurbineOperationalParameters.description: The general operational parameters for the turbine.  These are used to calculate equilibrium or steady state conditions to find the initial conditions for a time domain calculation, or for steady calculations such as the Steady Operational Loads calculation.
TurbineOperationalParameters.markdownDescription:
TurbineOperationalParameters: **object (TurbineOperationalParameters)**

_The general operational parameters for the turbine.  These are used to calculate equilibrium or steady state conditions to find the initial conditions for a time domain calculation, or for steady calculations such as the Steady Operational Loads calculation._

Control.description: The definition of how the turbine is controlled.
Control.markdownDescription:
Control: **object (BladedControl)**

_The definition of how the turbine is controlled._

Optional

GlobalExternalModules.description: A list of any external modules that will be run with the time domain simulations.  It is expected that external modules defined here will interact with more than one area of the turbine, such as to apply additional aerodynamics loads to the entire structure.  Any external modules that represent a single component should be added to the Assembly tree.
GlobalExternalModules.markdownDescription:
GlobalExternalModules: **array[object (ExternalModule)]**

_**Not supported yet**_

_A list of any external modules that will be run with the time domain simulations.  It is expected that external modules defined here will interact with more than one area of the turbine, such as to apply additional aerodynamics loads to the entire structure.  Any external modules that represent a single component should be added to the Assembly tree._

Optional

MeanSeaLevel.description: The mean sea depth at the turbine location.  If omitted, the Turbine will be considered an on-shore turbine and any sea states will be ignored.
MeanSeaLevel.markdownDescription:
MeanSeaLevel: **number** (m)

_**Not supported yet**_

_The mean sea depth at the turbine location.  If omitted, the Turbine will be considered an on-shore turbine and any sea states will be ignored._

Optional

Assembly.description: The definition of the turbine assembly, starting at the bottom of the tree, and specifying which components are attached to which others.
Assembly.markdownDescription:
Assembly: **object (Assembly)**

_The definition of the turbine assembly, starting at the bottom of the tree, and specifying which components are attached to which others._

ComponentLibrary.description: A repository to manage Component definitions.
ComponentLibrary.markdownDescription:
ComponentLibrary: **object (ComponentLibrary)**

_A repository to manage Component definitions._

NominalHubWindSpeedVsRotorSpeedAndPitchA.title: NominalHubWindSpeedVsRotorSpeedAndPitchAngle
NominalHubWindSpeedVsRotorSpeedAndPitchA.description: The look-up table for specifying the nominal free-field wind speed at the hub against the turbine's operating condition appropriate for that wind speed.  Wind speeds need to be in monotonic ascending order. Linear interpolation is used between points. The lowest value for the hub wind speed will be taken as the cut-in wind speed for the turbine, and the highest the cut-out wind speed.
NominalHubWindSpeedVsRotorSpeedAndPitchA.markdownDescription:
### NominalHubWindSpeedVsRotorSpeedAndPitchAngle

_The look-up table for specifying the nominal free-field wind speed at the hub against the turbine's operating condition appropriate for that wind speed.  Wind speeds need to be in monotonic ascending order. Linear interpolation is used between points. The lowest value for the hub wind speed will be taken as the cut-in wind speed for the turbine, and the highest the cut-out wind speed._

- `NominalHubWindSpeed`: **number** (m/s)
- `RotorSpeed`: **number** (rad/s)
- `PitchAngle`: **number** (rad)

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

NominalHubWindSpeed.description: The nominal free-field wind speed at the hub.
NominalHubWindSpeed.markdownDescription:
NominalHubWindSpeed: **number** (m/s)

_The nominal free-field wind speed at the hub._

RotorSpeed.description: The rotor speed to apply for the specified hub wind speed in steady state/initial condition calculations. The generator torque will be calculated to achieve this rotor speed.  If the torque required is negative, a warning will be generated.
RotorSpeed.markdownDescription:
RotorSpeed: **number** (rad/s)

_The rotor speed to apply for the specified hub wind speed in steady state/initial condition calculations. The generator torque will be calculated to achieve this rotor speed.  If the torque required is negative, a warning will be generated._

PitchAngle.description: The pitch angle to apply to all blades for the specified hub wind speed in steady state/initial condition calculations.
PitchAngle.markdownDescription:
PitchAngle: **number** (rad)

_The pitch angle to apply to all blades for the specified hub wind speed in steady state/initial condition calculations._

TurbineOperationalParameters.title: TurbineOperationalParameters
TurbineOperationalParameters.description: The general operational parameters for the turbine. These are used to calculate steady state conditions for steady calculation types or initial conditions for time-domain calculation types.
TurbineOperationalParameters.markdownDescription:
### TurbineOperationalParameters

_The general operational parameters for the turbine. These are used to calculate steady state conditions for steady calculation types or initial conditions for time-domain calculation types._

- `NominalHubWindSpeedVsRotorSpeedAndPitchAngle`: **array[object (NominalHubWindSpeedVsRotorSpeedAndPitchAngle)]**
- `VariableSpeedPitchRegulatedControlModel`: **object (VariableSpeedPitchRegulatedControlModel)**
- `PitchAngleWhilstIdling`: **number** (rad), _Optional_
- `PitchAngleWhilstParked`: **number** (rad), _Optional_

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

NominalHubWindSpeedVsRotorSpeedAndPitchA.description: User defined look-up table to define the steady state conditions of rotor speed and pitch angle over wind speed. If defined Bladed will use these values instead of trying to determine them.
NominalHubWindSpeedVsRotorSpeedAndPitchA.markdownDescription:
NominalHubWindSpeedVsRotorSpeedAndPitchAngle: **array[object (NominalHubWindSpeedVsRotorSpeedAndPitchAngle)]**

_User defined look-up table to define the steady state conditions of rotor speed and pitch angle over wind speed. If defined Bladed will use these values instead of trying to determine them._

VariableSpeedPitchRegulatedControlModel.description: The operational parameters that Bladed uses to determine the steady state conditions of the turbine. Although some of the values will be made available to the external controller through the API, they will not be used by Bladed during a time domain simulation.
VariableSpeedPitchRegulatedControlModel.markdownDescription:
VariableSpeedPitchRegulatedControlModel: **object (VariableSpeedPitchRegulatedControlModel)**

_The operational parameters that Bladed uses to determine the steady state conditions of the turbine. Although some of the values will be made available to the external controller through the API, they will not be used by Bladed during a time domain simulation._

PitchAngleWhilstIdling.description: The pitch angle of the blades when the turbine is idling.  The default is 90 degrees.
PitchAngleWhilstIdling.markdownDescription:
PitchAngleWhilstIdling: **number** (rad)

_The pitch angle of the blades when the turbine is idling.  The default is 90 degrees._

Optional, Default = `1.570796326794`

PitchAngleWhilstParked.description: The pitch angle of the blades when the turbine is parked.  The default is 90 degrees.
PitchAngleWhilstParked.markdownDescription:
PitchAngleWhilstParked: **number** (rad)

_The pitch angle of the blades when the turbine is parked.  The default is 90 degrees._

Optional, Default = `1.570796326794`

FullLoadOperation.title: FullLoadOperation
FullLoadOperation.description: The general parameters of the pitch control strategy while the turbine is operating at its full rated power.  These are used to determine steady-state conditions, such as the initial conditions for a time-domain simulation.
FullLoadOperation.markdownDescription:
### FullLoadOperation

_The general parameters of the pitch control strategy while the turbine is operating at its full rated power.  These are used to determine steady-state conditions, such as the initial conditions for a time-domain simulation._

- `GeneratorTorque`: **number** (Nm)
- `GeneratorSpeed`: **number** (rad/s)

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

GeneratorTorque.description: The generator torque while the turbine is operating at its rated power.
GeneratorTorque.markdownDescription:
GeneratorTorque: **number** (Nm)

_The generator torque while the turbine is operating at its rated power._

GeneratorSpeed.description: The speed when the turbine is operating at its rated power.
GeneratorSpeed.markdownDescription:
GeneratorSpeed: **number** (rad/s)

_The speed when the turbine is operating at its rated power._

NominalHubWindSpeedVsMinimumSteadyStateP.title: NominalHubWindSpeedVsMinimumSteadyStatePitchAngle
NominalHubWindSpeedVsMinimumSteadyStateP.description: The look-up table for specifying the nominal free-field wind speed at the hub against the respective minimum pitch angle for pitch scheduling. Wind speeds need to be in monotonic ascending order. Linear interpolation is used between points. If the hub wind speed exceeds the specified value the nearest will be used and a warning message will be written.
NominalHubWindSpeedVsMinimumSteadyStateP.markdownDescription:
### NominalHubWindSpeedVsMinimumSteadyStatePitchAngle

_The look-up table for specifying the nominal free-field wind speed at the hub against the respective minimum pitch angle for pitch scheduling. Wind speeds need to be in monotonic ascending order. Linear interpolation is used between points. If the hub wind speed exceeds the specified value the nearest will be used and a warning message will be written._

- `HubWindSpeed`: **number** (m/s)
- `MinimumSteadyStatePitchAngle`: **number** (rad)

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

HubWindSpeed.description: The nominal free-field wind speed at the hub for which the minimum pitch angle will apply.
HubWindSpeed.markdownDescription:
HubWindSpeed: **number** (m/s)

_The nominal free-field wind speed at the hub for which the minimum pitch angle will apply._

MinimumSteadyStatePitchAngle.description: The minimum pitch angle demand of the blades that the turbine control will apply for the specified wind speed.  The initial conditions may choose a higher pitch angle in order to achieve an equilibrium, but not a lower one.
MinimumSteadyStatePitchAngle.markdownDescription:
MinimumSteadyStatePitchAngle: **number** (rad)

_The minimum pitch angle demand of the blades that the turbine control will apply for the specified wind speed.  The initial conditions may choose a higher pitch angle in order to achieve an equilibrium, but not a lower one._

GeneratorSpeedVsGeneratorTorque.title: GeneratorSpeedVsGeneratorTorque
GeneratorSpeedVsGeneratorTorque.description: A row in a look-up table representing the applied torque for a given generator speed.
GeneratorSpeedVsGeneratorTorque.markdownDescription:
### GeneratorSpeedVsGeneratorTorque

_A row in a look-up table representing the applied torque for a given generator speed._

- `GeneratorSpeed`: **number** (rad/s)
- `GeneratorTorque`: **number** (Nm)

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

GeneratorSpeed.description: The angular velocity of the generator.
GeneratorSpeed.markdownDescription:
GeneratorSpeed: **number** (rad/s)

_The angular velocity of the generator._

GeneratorTorque.description: The torque produced by the generator for the given generator speed.
GeneratorTorque.markdownDescription:
GeneratorTorque: **number** (Nm)

_The torque produced by the generator for the given generator speed._

PartialLoadOperation.title: PartialLoadOperation
PartialLoadOperation.description: The general parameters of the torque control strategy while the turbine is operating at less than its rated power.  These are used to determine steady-state conditions, such as the initial conditions for a time-domain simulation.
PartialLoadOperation.markdownDescription:
### PartialLoadOperation

_The general parameters of the torque control strategy while the turbine is operating at less than its rated power.  These are used to determine steady-state conditions, such as the initial conditions for a time-domain simulation._

- `OptimalModeGain`: **number** (rad)
- `MinimumGeneratorSpeed`: **number** (rad/s)
- `GeneratorSpeedVsGeneratorTorque`: **array[object (GeneratorSpeedVsGeneratorTorque)]**

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

OptimalModeGain.description: The ratio between the generator torque demand and the square of the measured generator speed.
OptimalModeGain.markdownDescription:
OptimalModeGain: **number** (rad)

_The ratio between the generator torque demand and the square of the measured generator speed._

MinimumGeneratorSpeed.description: The minimum speed at which the generator will be producing power and thus apply a generator torque.
MinimumGeneratorSpeed.markdownDescription:
MinimumGeneratorSpeed: **number** (rad/s)

_The minimum speed at which the generator will be producing power and thus apply a generator torque._

GeneratorSpeedVsGeneratorTorque.description: A look-up table of the generator torque demand vs the measured generator speed. The table must extend up to FullLoadOperation.GeneratorSpeed which is the range Bladed will use.
GeneratorSpeedVsGeneratorTorque.markdownDescription:
GeneratorSpeedVsGeneratorTorque: **array[object (GeneratorSpeedVsGeneratorTorque)]**

_A look-up table of the generator torque demand vs the measured generator speed. The table must extend up to FullLoadOperation.GeneratorSpeed which is the range Bladed will use._

VariableSpeedPitchRegulatedControlModel.title: VariableSpeedPitchRegulatedControlModel
VariableSpeedPitchRegulatedControlModel.description: The operational parameters that Bladed uses to determine the steady state conditions of the turbine. Although some of the values will be made available to the external controller through the API, they will not be used by Bladed during the remainder of a time domain simulation.
VariableSpeedPitchRegulatedControlModel.markdownDescription:
### VariableSpeedPitchRegulatedControlModel

_The operational parameters that Bladed uses to determine the steady state conditions of the turbine. Although some of the values will be made available to the external controller through the API, they will not be used by Bladed during the remainder of a time domain simulation._

- `MinimumSteadyStatePitchAngle`: **number** (rad), _Optional_
- `MaximumSteadyStatePitchAngle`: **number** (rad)
- `NominalHubWindSpeedVsMinimumSteadyStatePitchAngle`: **array[object (NominalHubWindSpeedVsMinimumSteadyStatePitchAngle)]**, _Optional_
- `PartialLoadOperation`: **object (PartialLoadOperation)**
- `FullLoadOperation`: **object (FullLoadOperation)**

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

MinimumSteadyStatePitchAngle.description: This value represents the minimum allowable blade pitch angle used for determining pitch angle during steady state/initial condition calculation. It is combined with the MaximumSteadyStatePitchAngle to define the allowable pitch range. Additionally, the external controller API can access this value.
MinimumSteadyStatePitchAngle.markdownDescription:
MinimumSteadyStatePitchAngle: **number** (rad)

_This value represents the minimum allowable blade pitch angle used for determining pitch angle during steady state/initial condition calculation. It is combined with the MaximumSteadyStatePitchAngle to define the allowable pitch range. Additionally, the external controller API can access this value._

Optional

MaximumSteadyStatePitchAngle.description: This value represents the minimum allowable blade pitch angle used for determining pitch angle during steady state/initial condition calculation. It is combined with the MinimumSteadyStatePitchAngle to define the allowable pitch range. Please note that the steady-state algorithm does not support overspeed steady state conditions in cases where rotor speeds exceed the specified value for FullLoadOperation::GeneratorSpeed. Additionally, this value is accessible via the external controller API.
MaximumSteadyStatePitchAngle.markdownDescription:
MaximumSteadyStatePitchAngle: **number** (rad)

_This value represents the minimum allowable blade pitch angle used for determining pitch angle during steady state/initial condition calculation. It is combined with the MinimumSteadyStatePitchAngle to define the allowable pitch range. Please note that the steady-state algorithm does not support overspeed steady state conditions in cases where rotor speeds exceed the specified value for FullLoadOperation::GeneratorSpeed. Additionally, this value is accessible via the external controller API._

NominalHubWindSpeedVsMinimumSteadyStateP.description: The look-up table for specifying hub wind speed against the respective minimum pitch angle for pitch scheduling. Wind speeds need to be in monotonic ascending order. Linear interpolation is used between points. If the hub wind speed exceeds the specified value the nearest will be used and a warning message will be written.
NominalHubWindSpeedVsMinimumSteadyStateP.markdownDescription:
NominalHubWindSpeedVsMinimumSteadyStatePitchAngle: **array[object (NominalHubWindSpeedVsMinimumSteadyStatePitchAngle)]**

_The look-up table for specifying hub wind speed against the respective minimum pitch angle for pitch scheduling. Wind speeds need to be in monotonic ascending order. Linear interpolation is used between points. If the hub wind speed exceeds the specified value the nearest will be used and a warning message will be written._

Optional

PartialLoadOperation.description: The general parameters of the torque control strategy while the turbine is operating at less than its rated power.  These are used to determine steady-state conditions, such as the initial conditions for a time-domain simulation.
PartialLoadOperation.markdownDescription:
PartialLoadOperation: **object (PartialLoadOperation)**

_The general parameters of the torque control strategy while the turbine is operating at less than its rated power.  These are used to determine steady-state conditions, such as the initial conditions for a time-domain simulation._

FullLoadOperation.description: The general parameters of the pitch control strategy while the turbine is operating at its full rated power.  These are used to determine steady-state conditions, such as the initial conditions for a time-domain simulation.
FullLoadOperation.markdownDescription:
FullLoadOperation: **object (FullLoadOperation)**

_The general parameters of the pitch control strategy while the turbine is operating at its full rated power.  These are used to determine steady-state conditions, such as the initial conditions for a time-domain simulation._

ExponentialShearModel.title: ExponentialShearModel

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

A type of **WindShear**

ShearExponent.description: The exponential factor governing the shape of the wind shear variation.

ExternalModule.title: ExternalModule
ExternalModule.description: A specialised External Module component.  This is in the form of an external library (a dynamic link library on Windows, or a shared object on Linux).  This acts as a component in the Bladed assembly, and creates multibody objects to attach to the previous component.
ExternalModule.markdownDescription:
### ExternalModule

_A specialised External Module component.  This is in the form of an external library (a dynamic link library on Windows, or a shared object on Linux).  This acts as a component in the Bladed assembly, and creates multibody objects to attach to the previous component._

- `Filepath`: **string**
- `ParametersAsString`: **string**, _Optional_
- `ParametersAsJson`: **object**, _Optional_

or

- `$insert`: **string (URI-reference)**

Filepath.description: The absolute filepath to the dynamic linked library (Windows) or the shared object (Linux).
Filepath.markdownDescription:
Filepath: **string**

_The absolute filepath to the dynamic linked library (Windows) or the shared object (Linux)._

ParametersAsString.description: A string that will be passed to the external module.
ParametersAsString.markdownDescription:
ParametersAsString: **string**

_A string that will be passed to the external module._

Optional

ParametersAsJson.description: A JSON object that will be serialised as a string and passed to the external module.
ParametersAsJson.markdownDescription:
ParametersAsJson: **object**

_A JSON object that will be serialised as a string and passed to the external module._

Optional

SelectedComponentOutputGroup.title: SelectedComponentOutputGroup
SelectedComponentOutputGroup.description: A reference to the OutputGroup on a specific component within the assembly.
SelectedComponentOutputGroup.markdownDescription:
### SelectedComponentOutputGroup

_**Not supported yet**_

_A reference to the OutputGroup on a specific component within the assembly._

- ~~`@ComponentWithinAssembly`~~: **string (AssemblyReference)**
- ~~`@SelectedOutputGroup`~~: **string (OutputGroupKey)**

or

- ~~`$insert`~~: **string (URI-reference)**

@ComponentWithinAssembly.description:
A qualified, dot-separated path to a component in the assembly tree.

e.g. `Assembly.Hub.PitchSystem1.Blade`
@ComponentWithinAssembly.markdownDescription:
@ComponentWithinAssembly: **string (AssemblyReference)**

_**Not supported yet**_

_A qualified, dot-separated path to a component in the assembly tree._

_e.g. `Assembly.Hub.PitchSystem1.Blade`_

@SelectedOutputGroup.description: This is the name of the OutputGroup that should be used for the selected component, as defined in the OutputGroups library of the component's definition.

AssemblyReference.description: A qualified, dot-separated path to a component in the assembly tree.

ComponentLibraryKey.description: A key of a component definition in the ComponentLibrary.

AerofoilLibraryKey.description: A key of an Aerofoil entry in the AerofoilLibrary.

AerofoilKey.description: A key of an aerofoil definition in either the AerofoilLibrary, InterpolatedAerofoilLibrary or AileronAerofoilLibrary.

SafetyCircuitLibraryKey.description: A key of a SafetySystemCircuit entry in the SafetyCircuitLibrary.

TowerMaterialsLibraryKey.description: A key of a TowerMaterial entry in the TowerMaterialsLibrary.

OutputGroupKey.description: A key of an output group defined in the OutputGroups library of the component in context.

CrossReference.description: This is a JSON $ref style reference to another element in the JSON model.

Dimensionless.description: A number representing a fraction, ratio, or other non-dimensionalised property.

ModalStiffness.description: A number representing a modal stiffness.  This is always provided in SI units.

Length.description: A number representing a length.  The SI units for length are metres.

Velocity.description: A number representing a velocity.  The SI units for velocity are metres per second.

Area.description: A number representing an area.  The SI units for area are square metres.

Volume.description: A number representing a volume.  The SI units for volume are cubic metres.

Density.description: A number representing a material's density.  The SI units for volume are kilograms per cubic metre.

Duration.description: A number representing a time.  The SI units for time are seconds.

Voltage.description: A number representing an electrical voltage.  The SI units for voltage are Volts.

Resistance.description: A number representing an electrical resistance.  The SI units for resistance are Ohms, ℧.

Inductance.description: A number representing an electrical inductance.  The SI units for inductance are henrys (H).

Viscosity.description: A number representing a viscosity.  The SI units for viscosity are Newton seconds per metre squared.

Mass.description: A number representing a mass.  The SI units for mass are kilograms.

MassPerLength.description: A number representing a mass per unit length.  The SI units for mass per unit length are kilograms per metre.

Inertia.description: A number representing an inertia.  The SI units for inertia are kilogram metre squareds.

InertiaPerUnitLength.description: A number representing the second moment of mass per unit length in kilogram metre.

RateOfChangeOfInertia.description: A number representing the rate of change of an inertia.  The SI units for inertia are kilogram metre squareds per second.

MomentOfInertia.description: A number representing an angular inertia.  The SI units for angular inertia are kilogram radian squareds.

MomentOfInertiaPerLength.description: A number representing an angular inertia.  The SI units for angular inertia are kilogram radian squareds.

Force.description: A number representing a force.  The SI units for force are Newtons.

RateOfChangeOfForce.description: A number representing a rate of change of a force.  The SI units for force are Newtons per second.

Pressure.description: A number representing a pressure.  The SI units for pressure are Newtons per metre squareds.

Energy.description: A number representing an energy.  The SI units for energy are Joules.

Power.description: A number representing a power.  The SI units for Power are Watts.

RateOfChangeOfPower.description: A number representing the rate of change of a power.  The SI units for rate of change of a power are Watts per second.

FlowRate.description: A number representing the flow rate of a gas or liquid.  The SI units for flow rate are metre cubed per second.

FlowRatePerAngle.description: A number representing the flow rate of a gas or liquid per unit of angle passed.  The SI units for flow rate per unit angle are metre cubed per second per radian.

Moment.description: A number representing a torque or moment.  The SI units for moments are Newton-metres.

RateOfChangeOfMoment.description: A number representing the rate of change of a torque or moment.  The SI units for the rate of change of moments are Newton-metres per second.

AngularVelocity.description: A number representing angular velocity.  The SI units for angular velocity are radians per second.

LinearStiffness.description: A number representing an axial stiffness.  The SI units for axial stiffness are Newtons per metre.

LinearDamping.description: A number representing a linear damping term.  The SI units for linear damping are Newton seconds per metre.

Acceleration.description: A number representing a linear acceleration.  The SI units for acceleration are metres per second squared.

Jerk.description: A number representing a linear jerk.  The SI units for jerk are metres per second cubed.

Angle.description: A number representing an angle.  The SI units for angles are radians.

AnglePerLength.description: A number representing an angle varying by a length.  The SI units for angle per length radians per metre.

AngularStiffness.description: A number representing a rotational stiffness.  The SI units for rotational stiffness are Newton metres per radian.

CrossSectionAngularStiffness.description: A number representing a rotational stiffness for a section of e.g. a beam.  The SI units for rotational stiffness are Newton metres squared per radian.

AngularDamping.description: A number representing a rotational damping term.  The SI units for angular damping are Newton metre per radian.

AngularAcceleration.description: A number representing an angular acceleration.  The SI units for angular acceleration are radians per second squared.

AngularJerk.description: A number representing the rate of change of an angular acceleration.  The SI units for angular jerk are radians per second cubed.

Frequency.description: A number representing a frequency.  The SI units for frequency are Hertz (per seconds).

ReciprocalSquaredTime.description: A number representing the square of frequency.  The SI units for frequency are one over seconds squared.

MomentPerAngularVelocitySquared.description: A number representing the moment per angular velocity squared.  This is always provided in SI units, using radians.

Vector3D.description: A 3x1 vector representing a location or direction.

X.description: The x component of the 3x1 vector.
X.markdownDescription:
X: **number** (metres)

_The x component of the 3x1 vector._

Y.description: The y component of the 3x1 vector.
Y.markdownDescription:
Y: **number** (metres)

_The y component of the 3x1 vector._

Z.description: The z component of the 3x1 vector.
Z.markdownDescription:
Z: **number** (metres)

_The z component of the 3x1 vector._

TransformationMatrix.description: A 6x6 matrix to transform one set of coordinates into another.

InertiaMatrix.description: A 6x6 matrix of the linear and rotational inertias of an object.

MassMatrix.description: A 6x6 matrix representing the mass and rotational inertias of an object.  These are symmetric matrices for all real-world objects.

StiffnessMatrix.description: A 6x6 matrix representing the linear and rotational stiffnesses of an object or joint.

InsertProperty.description: A path to a resource from which a valid JSON model object can be resolved. All properties will be taken from the resolved object; no properties can be specified in-line.
InsertProperty.markdownDescription:
$insert: **string (URI-reference)**

_A path to a resource from which a valid JSON model object can be resolved. All properties will be taken from the resolved object; no properties can be specified in-line._

Optional

- _File paths can be absolute or relative to the current file._
- _Once resolved, the containing object must be valid according to the schema._

---

**Example**: Resolve an object in another JSON file:

```json
{
    "$insert": "./path/to/blade.json"
}
```

---

**Example**: Resolve an object contained inside a JSON object, in another JSON file:

```json
{
    "$insert": "./path/to/component-library.json#/Blade"
}
```

SchemaProperty.description: The location of the JSON schema used to validate this object and enable enhanced tooling support.
SchemaProperty.markdownDescription:
$schema: **string (URI-reference)**

_The location of the JSON schema used to validate this object and enable enhanced tooling support._

Optional

TimeDomainSimulation.description: Definition of a time domain analysis to perform.  This is mutually exclusive with 'SteadyCalculation'
TimeDomainSimulation.markdownDescription:
TimeDomainSimulation: **object (TimeDomainSimulation)**

_Definition of a time domain analysis to perform.  This is mutually exclusive with 'SteadyCalculation'_

SteadyCalculation.description: Definition of steady calculation to perform.  This is mutually exclusive with 'TimeDomainSimulation'.
SteadyCalculation.markdownDescription:
SteadyCalculation: **object (a type of SteadyCalculation)**

_Definition of steady calculation to perform.  This is mutually exclusive with 'TimeDomainSimulation'._

**SteadyCalculation** types: `AerodynamicInformation`, `CampbellDiagram`, `ModalAnalysis`, `ModelLinearisation`, `PerformanceCoefficients`, `SteadyOperationalLoads`, `SteadyParkedLoads`, `SteadyPowerCurve`

Settings.markdownDescription:
Settings: **object (Settings)**

_Configuration options for the analyses._

Optional

Constants.description: Physical properties for the analyses which do not vary throughout the analysis.
Constants.markdownDescription:
Constants: **object (Constants)**

_Physical properties for the analyses which do not vary throughout the analysis._

Optional

Turbine.description: The definition of the turbine to be analysed.
Turbine.markdownDescription:
Turbine: **object (Turbine)**

_The definition of the turbine to be analysed._

allOf.$comment: Required mutually exclusive fields: SteadyCalculation xor TimeDomainSimulation
